• The coated swash plate exhibits smooth surfaces, eliminating one or more machining steps in the manufacturing process, and performs equal to or better than hypereutectic alloys in terms of seizure loads and friction coefficient.

• The text describes the use of organic polymers in anti-reflective coatings for semiconductor devices, specifically for use in photolithography processes with short wavelength light sources such as 248 nm (KrF) and 193 nm (ArF) wavelengths.
• The polymers are designed to absorb light strongly at specific wavelengths to prevent the standing wave effect and light reflection in lithography processes, and to eliminate rear diffraction and reflected light from lower layers. The polymers can be prepared using reactions between commercially available or synthesized raw materials and an amine in a solvent at a specific temperature range. The anti-reflective coating composition containing the polymer can be prepared by dissolving the polymer in an organic solvent and adding one or more light-absorbing compounds. The composition can be coated on a semiconductor silicon wafer and hard-baked to form a cross-linked structure, resulting in a stable organic anti-reflective coating material.

1. * The invention describes a white, flame-retardant, UV-resistant, thermoformable, oriented film made from a crystallizable thermoplastic with a thickness of 10-350 μm. The film comprises at least one white pigment, one flame retardant, and one UV absorber, and has good orientability and thermoformability, and very good optical and mechanical properties.
2. * The invention also relates to the use of this film and to a process for its production. The film can be produced cost-effectively using industrial-standard dryers that operate at temperatures up to 170°C.
3. * The film is flame retardant, meaning it complies with the conditions of DIN 4102 Part 2 and Part 1, and can be allocated to construction materials class B 2 and B 1 for low-flammability materials. It also passes the UL 94 test, which permits its classification in class 94 VTM-0.
4. * High UV resistance means that sunlight or other UV radiation causes no, or only extremely little, damage to the films, so that the films are suitable for outdoor applications and/or critical indoor applications.
5. * Thermoformability means that the film can be thermoformed to give complex and large-surface-area moldings on commercially available thermoforming machinery, without uneconomic predrying.
6. * The film has good optical properties, including uniform coloration, high surface gloss, low light transmission, and a Yellowness Index unchanged from that of the flame-retardant and UV-modified film. It also has good mechanical properties, including high modulus of elasticity and good values for tensile stress at break.

1. The text describes a new process for manufacturing 1,1,1-trifluoroethane (143a) using an improved method of continuous gas phase hydrofluorination of 1,1-difluoro-1-chloroethane (142b) with heterogeneous catalysis.
2. The process provides a high conversion rate and selectivity (both over 99%) for 143a, making it a simple, convenient, and economical industrial process for manufacturing 143a.
3. The text also discusses various catalysts used in previous patents and their limitations, such as low conversion rates, low selectivity, and long regeneration times.
4. The new process uses a chromium catalyst, which can be unsupported or supported, and may include a cocatalyst selected from nickel, cobalt, and manganese salts.
5. The process operates at a temperature between 30° C. and 400° C., preferably between 30° and 280° C., and a contact time of 1-100 seconds. The molar ratio of HF:142b is in excess of 1:1, preferably in excess of 2.5:1.

• The invention describes an improved process for the preparation of certain pyrazolotriazoles from their triazolothiadiazine precursors.
• The improvement involves a deacylation and desulfurization step conducted in the presence of hypophosphorous acid.
• Use of hypophosphorous acid reduces the amount of elemental sulfur and sulfur-containing organic impurities in the reaction.
• The process increases the yield of the desired product and reduces the formation of undesired impurities.
• The use of hypophosphorous acid also results in the formation of H2S by-product, which is readily removed from the reaction zone.
• The process is straightforward, economical, and adaptable by industry.
• The invention also provides a process for the preparation of a 3,6-di-substituted-1H-pyrazolo[5,1-c]-1,2,4-triazole having the formula: ##STR7##
• The process comprises reacting an acylated compound with an aqueous mixture of hypophosphorous acid and hydrochloric or hydrobromic acid to produce hydrogen sulfide and the pyrazolotriazole.
• The process generates less sulfur and sulfur-containing organic impurities than when no hypophosphorous acid is present.

• The invention describes a method and apparatus for forming fiber mixtures from different fiber types by taking partial quantities from fiber bales in a sequential manner.
• The method involves measuring the entire momentary quantity of a stored fiber lot prior to each pass of the bale opener and determining a partial quantity that corresponds to a predetermined proportion of the momentary entire quantity.
• The partial quantity is continuously removed only from the measured fiber lot, ensuring that all fiber bales are opened without fiber residuals and an optimally homogeneous mixture is obtained.
• The method also involves removing the partial quantity not later than the end of a predetermined period, ensuring a determined time schedule in the opening of the fiber bales and preventing idle run of after-connected processing machines.
• The apparatus includes a bale opener, a quantity measuring device associated with the opener, and a control device that controls the mode of operation of the opener as a function of the signals transmitted by the quantity measuring device.
• The quantity measuring device is preferably a height-measuring arrangement that effects a simple and accurate determination of the partial fiber quantities to be removed from the bales.
• The control apparatus controls the displacement of the transporting device on which the bale opener is mounted, the beginning and the end of the bale opening operation, and the reversal of the direction of operation of the bale opener.
• The invention also describes a fiber removing apparatus, a quantity measuring apparatus, and a control apparatus that controls the mode of operation of the fiber removing apparatus.

• The invention describes a method and apparatus for forming bias laid, non-woven fabrics, where the yarns in at least two of the layers of fabric are laid at an angle of 30° to 150° to the long axis of the fabric. The yarns in the various layers are held together by stitching through the layers or by other external means such as adhesive bonding.

• The invention also describes a rake mechanism, synchronized with, but driven separately from, the conveyors, yarn carrying means, and bonding mechanism, which is used to achieve greater assurance of parallelism of the yarns and better control of the strength and thickness of the resulting layer. The rake mechanism can accept and retain the yarns being carried by the yarn carrying means at either end of the extremities of travel of the yarn carrying means, and can place the yarns onto or between the appropriate needles on the conveyors of the fabric forming mechanism.

• The invention relates to a method and apparatus for inserting weft threads with appropriate weft carrying forces in a multiple-color air jet loom.
• The apparatus includes a pneumatic piping system with subnozzles divided into different groups, producing different additional weft carrying forces for warp sheds.
• The weft insertion apparatus is controlled by on-off valves, which are selectively actuated by a mechanical cam device or an electric signal generator, to supply air under different pressures or for different intervals of time.
• The invention ensures stable insertion of various kinds of weft threads and prevents wastage of pressurized air, especially when inserting thinner weft threads.
• The invention is applicable to air jet looms using more than two different weft threads and can be incorporated in a multiple-color air jet loom having no subnozzles.

1. The invention describes a process for spinning bast fibers, such as jute, kenaf, or hemp fibers, which includes health preserving the fibers in a controlled temperature and humidity environment before and after carding and drawing them into bast fiber strips. This process reduces the end breakage rate during spinning, improving work efficiency and product quality.
2. The invention also describes a process for blended spinning bast fibers and other fibers, such as cotton, terylene, or polypropylene, which includes health preserving the blended fibers in a controlled temperature and humidity environment before spinning them into multi-fiber yarn. This process also reduces the end breakage rate during spinning, improving work efficiency and product quality.
3. The invention includes various examples of the processes with different temperatures, humidity levels, and durations of health preservation, as well as blending ratios of bast fibers and other fibers. The invention also includes a description of the advantages of the invention over existing technologies.

- The text describes a method and apparatus for measuring and removing rotational variability from the nip pressure profile of nip presses used in various industries, with a focus on papermaking. The invention uses imbedded sensors in covered rolls to detect variations in pressure along the length and rotation of the roll, compensating for rotational variability to obtain a more true profile of the nip pressure being developed.
- The invention is particularly important in papermaking, where even nip pressure along the roll is important for moisture content, caliper, sheet strength, and surface appearance. Uneven pressure distribution can result in poor quality paper, while improvements in nip loading can lead to higher productivity and lower breakdowns.

* The invention is a combination electrical cord support and article holder for an ironing board.
* The cord support has a flexible mast with a foot portion that can be raised and held in place by a detent, and a coiled spring resilient section to support the electrical cord of an iron.
* The article holder is a circular hoop with support bars that can hold items like cans or bottles, and can be detached from the clamp when not in use.
* The clamp has a retainer for the cord support and a second brace for detachably mounting the article holder, and can be secured to an ironing board using an adjustment screw and a movable clamp jaw.

• The invention is a buttonhole controlling device for a sewing machine that can create buttonholes of a consistent length regardless of the type of material being sewn.
• The device includes a foot pad attached to a presser bar, a travelling assembly with a slidable member, a tripping lever, and an adjustable stop.
• The slidable member can be positioned by a button for which a buttonhole is to be sewn, and carries a tab to actuate the tripping lever and limit the length of the buttonhole.
• The adjustable stop engages the tripping lever to terminate the formation of a buttonhole, allowing the operator to precisely define the closure point and prevent open or overlapping buttonholes.
• The device is adapted from the one disclosed in U.S. Pat. No. 3,877,403 of The Singer Co., with modifications to control the operation of the tripping lever and the machine's flexible contacts.
• The device is generally suitable for use with sewing machines that operate as in U.S. Pat. No. 3,841,246, and can be adjusted for use with different types of materials.

* The text describes an apparatus for treating a dyed or printed textile web with a liquid, such as a washing or rinsing solution.
* The apparatus includes a conveyor (endless sieve belt) for transporting the textile web, a liquid applicator for applying the liquid to the web, a suction device for removing the liquid from the web, and a dwell stretch for conducting the textile web in a spread-out condition and in a single layer through at least one dwell loop.
* This design allows for a longer action time of the applied liquid on the substances to be removed from the fabric or textile web, which can result in a surprising improvement of the washing effect.
* The tension in the textile web can be maintained at a small level, and the apparatus is especially advantageous for printed material as it allows for effective washing without soiling a white background.

• The text describes a dry cleaning machine with a separate intake fan and duct to bring ambient air into the access opening whenever the door is opened, reducing the exhaust of residual solvent vapors from the tubs. This is achieved through a normally closed valve that isolates the intake system from the solvent vapors during normal operation.

• The machine includes a solvent flow system and an air flow system, each with distinct components and functions throughout the various portions of the cleaning cycle. The solvent flow system includes a pump, filters, a button trap, and a safety line to ensure continuous filtration and safe solvent distribution. The air flow system includes a header chamber, airflow hoses, and electrically energized one-way valves to control airflow and prevent user exposure to solvent vapor fumes.

<summary>

* The text describes a method and apparatus for forming a melt spun nonwoven web using a new spinning process that combines the advantages of eductive and non-eductive systems.
* The process involves providing a thermoplastic polymer in a fluid condition, spinning filaments through a spinneret into a quench chamber, and drawing the filaments through a narrowing lower end of the quenching chamber into an impingement point slot opening.
* The apparatus includes a web forming table with a vacuum suction box and a moving mesh wire belt conveyor to receive the filaments and form them into a non-woven web.

</summary>

Note: The summary is a brief and general description of the text, and it does not include all the details and specific examples provided in the text.

1. The sewing machine includes a bed, a pillar, an arm, and a head. The bed is a base portion of the sewing machine and extends in the left-right direction. The pillar extends upward from the right end of the bed. The arm extends to the left from the upper end of the pillar such that the arm faces the bed. The head is provided on the left end of the arm.
2. The sewing machine includes a needle plate, a feed dog, a feed mechanism, a shuttle mechanism, a feed adjustment motor, a needle bar mechanism, a needle bar swinging motor, a receiver, a cover, a thread spool, an upper thread, a presser bar, a presser foot, and a plurality of operation switches.
3. The sewing machine further includes a liquid crystal display (LCD) and a touch panel. The LCD may display images that include various types of items, such as a command, an illustration, a set value, a message, and the like. The touch panel detects a position pressed by a finger or a dedicated touch pen.
4. The ultrasonic pen includes a pen body, a pen tip, a switch, a signal output circuit, and an ultrasonic transmitter. The switch is turned on and off in accordance with the position of the pen tip. The switch may switch output states of the signal output circuit and the ultrasonic transmitter. When the switch is turned on, the signal output circuit outputs an electrical signal to the sewing machine via a cable, and the ultrasonic transmitter transmits an ultrasonic wave. The sewing machine can receive (detect) the ultrasonic wave transmitted from the ultrasonic pen using the receivers. Based on the detected ultrasonic wave, the sewing machine can identify a transmission source of the ultrasonic wave, namely, the position of the ultrasonic transmitter provided in the ultrasonic pen. The sewing machine can perform sewing based on the identified position.

- The invention describes methods and compositions for enhancing the durability of functional enhancements of cellulosic fabric materials using a preparation comprising a blended mixture of wool particles or wool powder and a binding agent, where the functional additive is carried by the wool particles.
- The wool particles or wool powder used in the preparation are preferably of macrofibril size or below, and have demonstrated exceptional functional additive-carrying and retention ability.
- The preparation can be applied to cellulosic fabric materials such as cotton or linen using various methods, including printing, padding, or foam application.
- The functional additives can include various agents for enhancing functional properties, such as ultraviolet protection, anti-bacterial, or moisture management properties.

• The text describes an automatic quilting machine that includes a frame quilting machine with a large metal frame, a reprogrammable function for stitching patterns into a fabric, and a computer-aided design program for creating and duplicating patterns. The machine is controlled by two separate computers, one controlling the sewing machine function and the other controlling the quilting table motion. This allows for independent reprogramming of the sewing machine and table motion, simplifying the process of making adjustments or changes to the stitch or accessory functions or the table movement.

• The machine is designed for stitching individualized patterns into large fabrics such as bedspreads or quilts. The fabric is stretched on a metal frame, which is mounted on a table that can be moved in the X, Y, or X-Y direction. The sewing machine head is mounted on a cross beam and stitches patterns into the fabric as the table moves relative to the fixed sewing machine head. The reprogrammable function allows the operator to manually draw a pattern on a monitor, which is then converted into computer language and stored in the memory of the computer. The pattern can then be duplicated as often as desired and the machine will automatically stitch the pattern into the marked locations on the fabric.

* The invention is a method of forming a two-sided nonwoven fabric with a durable three-dimensional image on both sides.
* The method involves hydroentanglement of a first precursor web and a second precursor web, with an interposed fiber distribution control layer, on a moveable imaging surface having a three-dimensional image transfer device.
* The first and second precursor webs can comprise staple length fibers or substantially continuous filaments, and are carded and cross-lapped to form precursor webs.
* The precursor webs can be subjected to pre-entangling on a foraminous-forming surface prior to juxtaposition of a support layer or scrim and subsequent three-dimensional imaging.
* The fabric can have a first side or surface comprised of a first fibrous matrix and a second side or surface comprised of a second fibrous matrix, separated by an intermediate water pervious, fiber distribution control layer.
* The fabric can further include apertures that extend partially or entirely through one or more of the component layers.
* The fibrous constituent of the first fibrous matrix and the second fibrous matrix can exhibit a by fiber modulus difference of at least 10%, with the fibrous matrix with the lower fiber modulus coming in contact with the three-dimensional imaging transfer device.
* Subsequent to hydroentanglement, the three-dimensionally imaged fabric can be subjected to post-entanglement treatments such as application of a polymeric binder composition, mechanical compacting, application of surfactant or electrostatic compositions, and like processes.
* The precursor webs can be hydroentangled on a foraminous surface prior to hydroentangling on the image transfer device to integrate the fibrous components of the web without imparting a three-dimensional image.

<summary>

* The invention describes a sewing machine device that includes a guide chute for feeding a strip of add-on material over the bed plate, where the material is fed into association with a workpiece.
* A stop is arranged in the feed path of the strip for contacting and stopping the feeding thereof, which is displaceable out of the path and connectable by control means to the sewing machine for controlling the operation of the sewing machine in accordance with the position of the stop and the strip material.
* The device is designed to be simple in design, rugged in construction, and economical to manufacture.

</summary>

Note: The above summary is a brief and general overview of the invention and does not cover all the details and features mentioned in the text.

* The invention describes a connective knitting method for two tape-shaped knit pieces using a flat knitting machine with movable needle beds.
 * The method involves knitting two tape-shaped knit pieces in different ranges across the boundary in the longitudinal direction of one of the needle beds.
 * When the two pieces reach a specified length, the loop portion of the final course of one of the knit fabrics is transferred to the needles of the other needle bed.
 * The needle bed is moved so that the loop portion of the end part of the moving side knit fabric is overlaid on the loop of the end part of the part adjoining other fixed side knit fabric.
 * A new loop is formed on the overlaid part, decreasing one loop in the moving side knit fabric.
 * This sequence of forming a new loop on an overlaid loop is repeated until the end parts of both knit fabrics are joined and the final end portion of the junction is prevented from loosening the stitch.
 * The method increases productivity, reduces manufacturing cost, and provides a more regular and higher-quality product compared to manual sewing methods.
 * The invention can be applied to various parts of garments, such as the collar part of a sweater, the neck rope part of a tanktop, the lower end portion of baseball stockings, and the neck rope part of an apron.
 * The two pieces of knit fabric are knitted together and the transfers are carried out by a controlled computer following a designed knitting pattern.
 * The method can be applied to knitting machines with multiple knitting needles disposed on a pair or more of needle beds, and the matrix texture of the belt-shaped knit fabric can be plain knitting, rib knitting, tubular knitting, or any other.

• The invention describes a traction element, a production line, and a method for producing a traction element with improved flexibility and adhesion between the stranded cables and the plastics material jacket.
• The traction element has a core strand sheathed by a flexible thermoplastic plastics material layer, and stranded cables with at least six peripheral strand cords wound around a central strand cord. The strand cords consist of individual fibers or wires of a material guaranteeing tensile strength.
• The production line includes an extruder with a thread guide for the stranded cables and at least one matrix, which can be adjusted with and in relation to one another. The stranded cables run through the extruder and the outlet opening of the matrix, lying on one plane.
• The method for embedding at least one stranded cable with a plastics material-coated core strand involves degreasing and/or pretreating the unwound stranded cables, preheating them to a temperature of about ±20° C. of the melting temperature of the flexible thermoplastic plastics material sheathing the core strands, and sheathing them in the extruder with the liquefied plastics material.
• The invention aims to ensure increased flexibility, improved adhesion, and more precise control of the spacing of the stranded cables in the traction element, delivering band-shaped traction elements of the best commercially available quality.

• The invention is a new and useful rotary hook arrangement for a lockstitch sewing machine that minimizes impediment to the guiding of the needle thread loop during sewing.
• The rotary hook includes a hook body, hook tip, and bobbin housing with a bobbin capsule carrier and removable bobbin capsule. A triangular shoulder is formed by two laterally projecting projections on the bobbin housing.
• The rotary hook is supported by a spring rod that engages with the rear side face of the shoulder to prevent co-rotation and reverse rotation of the bobbin housing.
• A capsule release device is included to give the bobbin housing a rotational impulse counter to the direction of hook rotation, allowing the needle thread loop to slip through the thread passage gap unhindered.
• The rotary hook arrangement is simple in design, rugged in construction, and economical to manufacture.
• The invention allows for a jerk-free and low friction motion of the needle thread loop, resulting in high-quality stitch formation.

• The text describes a method for producing silicon-based nanowires using four-component and five-component liquid silane inks.
• The four-component inks consist of a liquid silane, a polymer, an accelerant, and a solvent, while the five-component inks also include a solid phase.
• The liquid silane is typically cyclohexasilane (Si6H12), which undergoes ring opening polymerization to form solid polydihydrosilane (SiH2)n, which is then transformed into amorphous silicon and crystalline silicon through thermal treatment.
• The polymer is typically poly(methyl methacrylate), and the accelerant is a polyhydropolysilane that accelerates the polymerization of cyclohexasilane.
• The solvent is typically toluene, xylene, cyclooctane, 1,2,4-trichlorobenzene, or dichloromethane.
• The solid phase in the five-component inks can be metallic particles, graphite, carbon black, graphene, wires or tubes, or semiconducting particles.
• The nanofibers produced from the inks can be transformed into polysilane-containing materials, amorphous silicon-containing materials, or crystalline silicon-containing materials through thermal treatment.
• The transformed fibers can be coated with a coherent, conductive coating and used as a component of composite materials such as an anode material for a lithium-ion battery.
• The invention also provides four-component or five-component silane inks that can be used in the formation of silicon-based films and nanofibers and composite materials.

* The present invention is related to an arrangement for controlling thread tension in a spool creel.
* The arrangement has a plurality of spool holders, each provided with a brake rotor and an adjustable, tension responsive, braking element.
* A tensioning lever is coupled to the braking element for biasing it, and the tensioning lever has a roller adapted to engage and be biased by the threads.
* The tensioning lever is operable to occupy an angular position dependent upon thread tension and weight.
* A biasing arrangement, activated by fluid pressure, is connected to the tensioning lever, and each of the tension levers is simultaneously settable by the fluid pressure.
* The force generated by the biasing arrangement operates in addition to the weight force on the tensioning lever, whereby the thread tension is also altered.
* The change in thread tension can be centrally set so that the thread tension can be determined for the entire creel.
* The braking force throughout the entire creel can be increased so that a quick braking action is possible when the warping machine served by the creel is shut off.
* The tensioning lever ensures that the braking shoe on restart of the warping machine is removed from contact with the further braking surface and therefore no locking can occur.
* The magnetic system brakes by generating eddy currents in braking disc, and the more disc is covered by the system, the greater the braking effect.

• The present invention is a sewing machine detector for detecting the position of a sewing needle and the speed of the sewing machine.
• The detector is integral with the drive and control elements of the sewing machine.
• The detector includes a sewing machine shaft, a shaft connected to the sewing machine shaft, and needle UP and DOWN position detecting reflective discs installed on the shaft.
• Light from a needle UP position detecting optical fiber and a needle DOWN position detecting optical fiber is reflected by the reflecting portions of the reflective discs and received by light receiving optical fibers.
• The reflected light is processed by a signal processing circuit and transmitted to the control circuit section for controlling the sewing machine.
• The detector eliminates the influence of static noise due to friction and other noise, preventing malfunction and ensuring stable sewing machine operations.
• The detector minimizes stress imposed on the optical fibers by minimizing their curvature.
• The detector includes a power indicating light that does not interfere with the operation of the detector and controller.
• The detector is more compact and durable than conventional detectors, and reduces the cost of manufacturing.
• The detector includes an optical fiber power indicating cable that does not interfere with sewing machine control circuitry and can be run simultaneously with the optical fibers for detection.

* The invention describes a process for the continuous production of viscose rayon yarns with a high degree of whiteness.
* The process includes completing coagulation, washing with non-alkaline pH water, drying, and possibly finishing.
* The completion of coagulation can be achieved through various methods, such as passing time, acid treatment, or a succession of both.
* The washing process reduces specific elements on the yarn, such as total sulphur, sulphur bound as sulphides, elemental sulphur, iron, zinc, and lead, to specified values.
* The process results in a finished yarn with a high degree of white, which cannot be further improved significantly.
* Preferred conditions for the process include spinning speeds not lower than 90 m/min, washing at temperatures between 20° and 30° C for 25-40 seconds, and completing coagulation in 15-40 seconds.

• The text describes a patent for a small deaeration tank used for removing oxygen from pulp after it has been treated with oxygen.
• The deaeration tank is designed to be placed on top of an oxygen reactor and have no moving parts.
• The tank uses a tangential swirl inducing inlet pipe to create a vortex and remove oxygen from the pulp.
• The swirling fluid used in the tank is the filtrate from the washer after the oxygen bleach.
• The system is designed to recover steam or oxygen and maintain a constant height of pulp in the tank.
• The tank is cylindrical, with an open top and flat bottom, and the diameter is normally the same as the diameter of the oxygen reactor.
• The inlet pipe for the pulp should allow the pulp to enter the tank above the surface of the slurry and splash against the side wall.
• The outlet is located in the bottom plate of the tank and is sized to handle the amount of pulp leaving the tank.
• A 50 ton per day installation of this system would have a tank with a diameter of 106.68 cm (42") and a height of 211.46 cm (831/4").

* The text describes a new composite material called BTR (biomimetic tendon-reinforced) that is designed using a methodology called "function-oriented material design" (FOMD). The FOMD process involves defining and quantifying the functions of a particular structure, and then optimizing the material design to meet those functions.
* The BTR composite is made of fibers that are evenly distributed in a matrix material and are concentrated and optimally arranged along load paths where reinforcement is most needed. This results in increased transverse stiffness and improved out-plane stiffness.
* The BTR composite can be extended to a three-dimensional lattice structure made of various raw materials, such as steel frame, steel columns, carbon-fiber ropes, and carbon fiber/epoxy cover panels. This structure can be fabricated by inserting bent-wire tendon elements into the ends of stuffer members to create linear structures, which can then be replicated to create a planar structure.
* The BTR composite can be used in a variety of applications, including the development of a composite armor that consists of stuffer, fiber ropes, woven fiber panels, and ceramic layers. The carbon-rope reinforcement plan in the composite armor can be optimized to withstand an actual impact, and the structure is ultra-light, which can benefit future combat systems in total weight reduction and energy absorption.

• The text describes a load-limiting device for use in braced frames of structures, which can undergo plastic deformation in response to a load applied thereto, allowing it to dissipate energy and preserve the structure from extensive damage during a dynamic event.
• The device can be easily removed and replaced after plastic deformation with another non-plastically deformed load-limiting device.
• The device can be integrated into a structural frame, including frames with X- or K-braces, and can help the frame withstand lateral seismic loads and high dynamic loads.
• The device can be manufactured with a plurality of connection points to connect to a typical braced frame, and can have a design that avoids local stress risers that may prematurely yield or fatigue with normal loads on a structure.

• The present invention relates to a bedroom cabinet designed for use as a flophouse facility, with a focus on mechanical strength, efficient use of space, and sound-proofing.
• The bedroom cabinet is composed of an outer casing and an inner casing, with a clearance between them that can be used to house boxes for electric devices or shelves for personal belongings, without projecting from the cabinet.
• The clearance between the outer and inner casings can also serve as an air flow passage for natural ventilation and sound-proofing, and spacer members with venting grooves can be used to ensure uniform air flow and increase sound-proofing effect.
• The bedroom cabinet is designed to be easily assembled and disassembled, with recesses and flanges on the upper and lower outer housings that allow for a secure fit.
• The inner casing is composed of six panels, including a front panel with an opening for the exit, a back panel with boxes for mounting devices, right and left side panels with shelves and backrests, a ceiling panel with vent holes and sound-proofing material, and a bottom panel with a rim for fixing a mat.

- The text describes a portable, temporary guard rail support for use in the construction industry to provide a safe work area for workmen working at dangerous heights. The guard rail support consists of a base plate, an upright column, L-shaped rail supporting brackets, a retaining flange, an angle brace, and a fall protection tie-off ring. The guard rail support can be used to construct a safety barrier with wooden guard rails and a kick board, and the fall protection tie-off ring can serve as retaining and attachment means for a safety cable or to fasten weatherproof tarpaulins.
- The text also describes a concrete-filled steel base that can receive the portable guard rail support in circumstances where anchoring of the portable guard rail support to a floor or ground surface is not possible. Additionally, the text mentions the possibility of using a mesh-like fence structure in conjunction with the guard rail supports to form a mesh-like safety barrier. The guard rail supports and associated guard rail assembly provide for easy installation and removal from sites under construction, and the all-steel construction ensures durability and repeated use for many years.

* The text describes a pulsed power device and method for Enhanced Oil Recovery (EOR) that uses the rapid release of electrical energy stored in capacitor banks to create a plasma channel in water, generating high pressures and temperatures.
* The device can be used in a plasma or electrohydraulic (EH) mode for various processes including geophysical exploration, mining, treatment of fluids, and EOR.
* The pulsed power method can also generate high-frequency acoustic stimulation of oil-bearing reservoirs separately from the direct acoustic response of the EH shock wave, through an electromagnetic pulse that induces a coupled acoustic vibration in geologic materials like quartz.
* This induced acoustic vibration acts for a short period of time after the pulse is discharged and is not limited by the natural acoustic attenuation that limits the effectiveness of a direct acoustic pulse source.
* An effective acoustic stimulation program can be designed by targeting acoustic stimulation frequencies at the specific scale of inclusions in the reservoir, which can optimize energy absorption and effective stimulation.
* The present invention uses a coupled process of direct EH acoustic vibrations and electromagnetically-induced high-frequency acoustic vibrations, which must occur together to effectively mobilize oil and increase production.
* The invention can be applied using a multi-level discharge device that allows sequential firing of several sources in one well in a time sequence, extending the effective range of the stimulation.
* The invention can also be extended to the placement of multiple tools in multiple wells to achieve better stimulation of a specific volume of the reservoir.
* The discharge characteristics of the pulse sources can be customized to produce specific frequencies that will achieve optimal stimulation by activating specific scales of inclusions in the reservoir.

• The text describes a continuation-in-part of a co-pending patent application for a Wave Anchor Soil Reinforcing Connector and Method.
• Mechanically Stabilized Earth (MSE) structures are retaining wall structures that use horizontally positioned soil inclusions to reinforce an earth mass in combination with a facing element.
• A typical soil reinforcing element for MSE structures includes a welded wire grid with longitudinal and transverse wires. The wall end of the element may include connective means to connect it to a vertical facing.
• There is a need for a system and method to splice a soil reinforcing element to extend its length.
• The disclosure provides a splice for a soil reinforcing element that includes wave plates, transverse protrusions, perforations, and a connective device. The splice couples the reinforcing element to a grid-strip, extending its length.
• The composite soil reinforcing element can be used to reinforce a vertical facing in MSE structures.

- The text describes a novel design for a plow blade that provides a fluid passage and points of fluid ejection, which can be produced with basic manufacturing processes. The blade construction includes a multiple component assembly, allowing for the ability to rebuild a blade and replace a portion of it that may be worn.
- The text also discusses a process of ejecting a specific fluid at specific points along a plow blade to maximize desirable characteristics while minimizing the volume of ejected fluid. This method is adaptable in static plowing and vibratory plowing utilities. Lubricating the sides of the blade/chute that come into contact with the ground with fluid has been found to greatly reduce the amount of drag (friction).

<summary>

* The invention is a building system that allows for the creation of larger exterior panels without the need for movement control joints.
* The system uses a reinforced plaster panel with a first mesh attached to battens and a second mesh supported by a plaster matrix.
* The system can be used to create panels of various sizes and shapes, including those with openings for doors and windows.
* The openings are further reinforced in the plaster matrix to provide additional support and stability.
* The system can be used with various types of mesh and reinforcement, including metallic and non-metallic materials.
* The system is intended to comply with New Zealand building codes and regulations, including the plaster code NZS4251 and the building code NZS3604.
* The system aims to provide panel rigidity and integrity, and can be used to create stucco walled structures.
* The system can be used to create walls of various sizes and configurations, including those with non-square or non-rectangular perimeters.
</summary>

The text describes a building system that allows for the creation of larger exterior panels without the need for movement control joints. The system uses a reinforced plaster panel with a first mesh attached to battens and a second mesh supported by a plaster matrix. The system can be used to create panels of various sizes and shapes, including those with openings for doors and windows. The openings are further reinforced in the plaster matrix to provide additional support and stability. The system can be used with various types of mesh and reinforcement, including metallic and non-metallic materials. The system is intended to comply with New Zealand building codes and regulations, including the plaster code NZS4251 and the building code NZS3604. The system aims to provide panel rigidity and integrity, and can be used to create stucco walled structures. The system can be used to create walls of various sizes and configurations, including those with non-square or non-rectangular perimeters.

* The text describes a new and improved safe and door structure, which is a readily assembled, low cost door and safe structure.
* The safe has a valuables receiving chamber with a generally rectangular opening and a first set of inwardly extending ledges on opposing walls for placement of a plate-shaped separate steel door thereon. It also has a set of grooves formed on the opposite walls transverse to the first set of opposing walls providing stops for retaining the door therein.
* The door engagement is achieved by inserting one edge of the door into a deeper groove at a slight angle while pivoting the other edge toward the ledge, and then laterally displacing the door until the latter edge is in abutment with the seat of the shallower groove.
* The lock assembly on the reverse side of the door has the latch bolt engaging a detent in one bar for prevention of lateral movement with reinforcing bolts on both sides of the lock bolt preventing transmission of force to the lock mechanism in the event of forceful intrusion attempts.

- The text describes various embodiments of geological formation pressure sensing systems that more accurately measure the formation pressures at desired depths. The inlet to the pressure sensing apparatus is located at a desired depth in the formation and isolated to pressures produced by the formation at such depth, ensuring the measurement of the formation pressure is not affected by other and different pressures that could exist in the borehole above and below the inlet to the pressure measuring apparatus.
- The text also discusses associated methods and manufacturing of these systems, including the use of cement grout to isolate the pressure transducer in the borehole, and the use of fluid injection to maintain pressure at the transducer and approximate formation pressure. The text highlights the importance of accurately measuring formation pressures for civil engineering, hydrogeology, and petroleum engineering applications.

• The invention describes a jointing structure in vehicle traveling path joints with an expansion function, which is adaptable for various tire configurations, ensures high slip resistance to tires, permits less occurrence of tire fall-in and/or stuck-in situations, and is easy to be maintained.
• The jointing structure comprises more than one step provided face to face at the coaxially built traveling path ends with an expansion gap between, more than one elastic member respectively mounted inside the above more than one step, and a joint block mounted on the above more than one elastic member across the above expansion gap.
• The elastic members are desirably of a material that is hard to be deformed vertically and vice verse easy to be deformed horizontally in a soft manner, and are fitted to each other detachably by bolting or the like.
• The joint block is placed across the expansion gap, and the adequate management of accuracy of each member can prevent differences in level from occurring in any joint portion between the joint block and the traveling path.
• The use of a joint block made of the same concrete as that of the traveling path can provide more substantially increased slip resistance to the tires, and a high-strength fiber-reinforced concrete joint block is highly durable and hardly worn away, making it suitable for the joint block.

• The invention relates to a floor track system for use in a fluid treatment chamber, specifically for moving wheeled trucks into and out of the chamber without contaminating the sanitary environment.
• The enclosed track includes a wheel channel that stands off the floor, preventing showered fluid or fluid flowing on the floor from entering the wheel channel area and becoming contaminated by the truck wheels.
• The wheel channel may include opposed sidewalls, one of which extends upwardly more than the other and has a cover plate horizontally overlying the top of the channel, accommodating the axle structure connecting the truck frame to the wheel.
• The cover plate may be connected to the longer sidewall by a hinge, allowing it to be pivoted away from the wheel channel for cleaning.
• In another embodiment, the enclosed floor track system accommodates trucks with downwardly depending struts supporting the wheel structure, utilizing inflatable elastomer seals along the length of the sidewall top edges to enclose around the hand truck wheel struts and prevent entry of the brine solution.
• The invention aims to prevent the brine solution from being showered onto the wheel structure of the hand trucks and becoming contaminated.
• The enclosed floor tracks are supported above the chamber floor by support legs, and the floor of the fluid treatment chamber is inclined to collect the warm brine solution in a sump where it is then cooled by a refrigeration system and returned to be cycled again.
• The tracks include an open wheel channel, a wheel guide, and upwardly extending sidewalls, with a cover plate attached to the outer sidewall by a hinge, which can be pivoted away to facilitate cleaning.
• The invention enhances the recovery and reuse of the brine solution by segregating the hand truck wheel structure from the general environment within the fluid treatment chamber.
• The enclosed floor track system prevents showered or dripping brine from entering into the track system, preserving natural resources and achieving an economic advantage.

1. The invention describes a lock device for preventing a boom of a backhoe work machine from being rotated downward by its own weight. The lock device includes an engaging member with a hook part and a slot, and an engaged member that can engage with the hook part. The engaging member is supported by a guide member and a support pin inserted into the slot. The guide member ensures that the engaging member maintains the lock position at any rotation position of the boom between its highest and lowest positions.
2. The engaging member is designed with a slanted end surface, which allows it to evade the engaged member when the boom is rotated to the lock position, preventing damage to both members.
3. The lock device also includes a slip-prevention plate that ensures the engaging member is prevented from slipping off the support pin, making the slip-prevention mechanism easy to construct and reducing the number of parts required.
4. The lock device is simple, cost-effective, and easy to assemble, making it suitable for use in various work machines such as excavating devices, loaders, and cranes.

• The present invention is a swimming pool vacuum cleaner with an adjustable suction head that can be easily regulated during pool cleaning operations.
• The adjustment mechanisms are conveniently located on the top of the vacuum head and can be quickly operated by hand without the need for hand tools.
• The suction exerted by the vacuum head can be precisely regulated without the need for regulation of the remotely located suction source.
• Adjustment mechanisms can be provided in kit form which can be interconnected with certain types of existing, prior art pool cleaning devices without the need for major retrofit of the existing devices.
• The adjustment mechanism is simple and easy to use, easy to connect to existing devices and can be manufactured very inexpensively.

* The invention is a tool for retrieving wear bushings from oil wells, which often protect against excessive wear in seal areas of casing heads and other well head elements.
* The tool is particularly useful when the drill pipe is lodged and the bit must be removed, leaving the drill collar and bit downhole.
* A wear sleeve or bushing section with a J-slot and a retriever body with outwardly protruding dowels are used to remove the bushing in the prior art.
* The present invention provides a sub-body with a mandrel and a removable lower collar section that threadably engages the end of a second lower section of drill pipe.
* A retriever section is insertable onto the mandrel and has protruding members for engaging with an extended J-slot of a wear bushing.
* The retriever section is prevented from rotational movement but allowed vertical movement along the mandrel.
* The apparatus can be removably secured on the exterior surface of a sub-unit so that it may be mounted on a string of drill pipe independently of threading on the pipe.
* The retriever apparatus allows vertical movement of the retrieving unit yet allows rotational movement of the retriever unit during the operation of the apparatus.
* The retriever unit may be mounted onto a mandrel and connected onto drill pipe and allow a vertical play or movement of the retriever unit in order to prevent damage to the retriever unit or the wear bushing or both due to excessive weight below retriever.
* The wear bushing retriever apparatus can be threadably engaged between any two sections of drill pipe without retrieval of the drill bit from the hole and is easily removable and installable for quickly removing the wear bushing during the drilling operation.

* The invention is a downhole vibratory tool that can selectively allow passage of other tools through it.
* The tool is used to dislodge stuck objects, known as fish, in a downhole location and to transmit pulling forces to a fish stuck in a deviated wellbore.
* Earlier vibratory tool designs did not have a central passageway for wireline access and had the dump valve located in the center of the tool, preventing clear passage for wireline or other tools.
* The new design has a dump valve in an annular shape, allowing for a central passageway for wireline access and eliminating the need for a dart to initiate operations.
* The tool is powered by stacked pistons in the tool body, increasing the delivered power from the vibratory tool.
* The tool can be run in a manner that delivers high amplitude low frequency oscillating forces to the stuck fish without impacts.
* The tool has a modular design, allowing for different numbers of rows of ports and pistons to be used, depending on the power required for the particular work string or downhole conditions.
* The tool can be operated with or without impacts, and can be used in stimulation or fishing operations.
* The tool can also have a rotational lock between the mandrel and the housing for torque transmission.
* The invention is not limited to the specific embodiments described, but is intended to be covered by the appended claims.

* The present invention describes a precast concrete retaining wall system with a face panel and a base, both connected by a counterfort piece that extends from the rear side of the face panel.
* The counterfort piece has reinforcing bars (rebar) that act as a tensioning device within the concrete and help meet design loads. The base is generally a rectangular or trapezoidal shaped platform and typically is set on grade.
* A shear key can be made between the face or counterforts and the base to solidify the connection. The connection between the face panel and base is made by inserting an end of a piece of rebar of one module into an opening in the other module and then sealing the connection with grout.
* Multiple retaining walls can be placed adjacent to one another to form a continuous wall, with a shear key or ship laps between adjacent modules to allow for flexibility.
* Several measures can be taken to prevent the base from sliding once it is backfilled and any surcharge loads are applied, such as texturing or roughening the bottom of the base, setting the base on shims with holes for grout, or using H-piles for added stability.

* The invention is a down hole heating system for oil and gas wells to improve flow rates impeded by high oil viscosity and/or paraffin blockage.
* The system includes production tubing, a heat insulating packer, perforated tubing, a stainless steel tubing collar, and a heating unit with electrical resistance heater rods.
* The heat insulating packer and stainless steel collars contain the heat within the desired zone and focus it on the production formation to heat the oil and paraffin in situ.
* The electrical connections between the power leads and heater rods are impenetrably shielded from pressures and hostile chemical agents in the well bore using a cement block and steel fitting assembly.
* Solid copper leads with KAPTON insulation are used to reliably deliver power to the connection.
* The method for using the system includes installing the down hole heating unit with shielded electrical connections and heat-retaining elements to properly focus heat on the producing formation. The method can also be used with cable for supporting the heating unit during other well treatments or maintenance.

• The invention describes a mechanism for installing and retrieving down hole objects in wells, such as a fishing tool used to remove objects stuck in a well bore.
• The fishing tool includes a collet-type device for establishing an internal connection with the object to be pulled and a locking mandrel that can be accurately positioned using an adjustable spacer element.
• The tool also includes a controllable locking mechanism with latching recesses and guide pins to control the latching and unlatching of the collet or spear slip structures with respect to the object.
• The latching and unlatching cycles can be repeated indefinitely without removing the tool from the well bore, and the tool can be used for a variety of down hole service operations including installation and removal of down hole tools and fishing operations for stuck or lost tools within the well bore.

• The present application is related to modular composed stave floors and claims priority to several previously filed patent applications.
• Thin sight substrates in conventional stave floors can deform or become detached during maintenance, affecting the floor's appearance and functionality.
• The sight substrate is typically "de-rolled" wood, which can curl or recover its original form, and is joined to the base substrate with glue.
• The base substrate is usually composed of slung wood or is plated against, and both sheets are joined with glue, which can take several days to fully harden.
• The short lifespan of composed stave floors is due to the thin sight substrate, and corrective maintenance is not possible.
• The example embodiment includes a method for manufacturing composed stave floors with a thicker sight substrate (at least 4 mm) and base substrate (at least 12 mm), assembled with glue and multidirectional holding means.
• The multidirectional holding means consist of dendrites, adhesion and horizontal reinforcement means in the union plane, and adhesion and vertical reinforcement means normal to the union plane.
• The thicker sight substrate and base substrate, along with the multidirectional holding means, prevent displacement or change of dimensions and provide improved durability and the ability to perform corrective maintenance.
• The example embodiment also includes the use of site-preferred glazes, such as aluminum oxide, to improve the hardness of the floor without changing its aesthetic appearance.
• The numerical parameters and ranges described in the application are to be considered approximations, and any sub-ranges are included in the scope of the claims.

• The invention relates to a ladder attachment that improves lateral stability, prevents slipping or sliding, and does not damage the work surface.
• The attachment includes a brace with an extension arm and a resilient pad assembly that can pivot to increase contact area with the work surface.
• The brace is secured to the ladder using a U-bolt and a clamp that exerts a force against the siderail to prevent motion.
• The design allows the ladder to straddle corners and maintain stability, and the resilient pad provides a non-slip gripping portion.
• The ladder attachment can be made of heavier gauge material or with additional bolts for use with less substantial ladders.
• The invention can be adapted to various situations and materials while maintaining its essential teachings.

* The present invention pertains to a collated nail strip formed with a debris-free plastic material for use in a fastener driving tool.
* Presently known collated nails are assembled using tape strips or an extruded plastic material, but these methods can create debris and shatter as the nails are driven into the workpiece.
* The invention aims to reduce debris and improve adhesion of the plastic to the nail shanks, while also minimizing the amount that the strip can flex.
* The collation system is configured to permit the collation to be coiled for use in driving tools that accept collations in this manner.
* The invention includes various features such as a notch in the connecting portion, a varying cross-sectional area, and a rib that extends less than the axial length of the collar portion.
* The assembly can also be configured with the connecting portion including a rib that extends less than an axial length of the collar portion and the rib having a width that is greater than the width of the collar.

* The invention is a nozzle for applying sealants such as silicones, useful in various industries including aviation, automotive, naval, railway, and robotics.
* The nozzle has a bell or hood lower section and an injection button, and is designed for easy injection of sealants in multiple industrial applications.
* The bell-shaped tip facilitates encapsulation of rivets or screws, particularly in the aeronautical industry, and the injection button has a special design with channels and orifices for greater accuracy in sealing operations.
* The button section improves encapsulation and provides optimum sealing of rivets and nuts, and allows for manual and automated sealant injection machines.
* The nozzle has a main elongated hollow body with a truncated cone shape, a first end with a wider diameter, and a second end with a bell or hood shaped section.
* The first end has a connecting hollow round section with a threaded exterior surface for connecting to a silicone or similar sealant cartridge or injection machine.
* The bell-shaped section is sized to encapsulate rivets or nuts and provides a connection element.
* The injection button is connected to the bell-shaped section and has a circular main body with a peripheral groove section, hollow central circular protrusion, and multiple series of radially oriented channels ending in orifices.
* The annular flanged section of the bell shaped section cooperatively matches with the peripheral groove of the injection button, allowing a strong and firm non-permanent connection.
* The nozzle may be used for applying sealants in a variety of applications, including encapsulating rivets or nuts, covering seams or joints, and filling gaps or voids.

• The text describes a position sensor that modifies an unconditioned sensing signal from a transducer into a conditioned sensing signal using a waveform generator and an error correction generator.
• The error correction generator determines and eliminates strong static signals and error signals that do not deliver information about the position of an object being sensed, thereby reducing energy consumption.
• A window reference circuit constantly compares a desired conditioned sensor signal output to an existing conditioned sensor signal output and adjusts the conditioned sensor signal output if it is above a preset high reference signal or below a preset low reference signal.
• The sensor monitoring system is remotely located and provides power to the sensor and receives the conditioned sensing signal via two wires, making the sensor desirable for multiplexing with other sensors.
• The sensor can be recalibrated at any time by removing and reapplying power.
• The sensor modulates a current across a pair of wires connected to the sensor monitoring system, where the modulated sensor current is converted into a modulated sensor signal voltage.

• The text describes a desmodromic valve actuation system for intake and exhaust function of a four-stroke piston in internal combustion engines, which eliminates the use of springs to close the valves.
• The system is designed to improve fuel efficiency and engine performance by precisely controlling the timing and duration of valve opening and closing.
• The system comprises a rotary cam that drives a reciprocating cam translating device, which in turn actuates the valves through a substantially infinitely variable reciprocating motion.
• The system can be computer-controlled to adjust the percentage opening of the valve ports, and to control the amount of air/gas mixture entering each piston, as well as to close any number of cylinders during operation.
• The system can also control the piston firing sequences and individual operations, and simplify the construction and operation of the valve actuator.
• The system can be used in various types of internal combustion engines, including those with multiple valves per cylinder.
• The system offers several advantages over conventional cam/spring valve actuation systems, including higher engine speed performance, more effective control of valve ports opening, and elimination of the need for springs.
• The system is designed to be simple, robust, and precise, and can contribute to a more efficient delivery of power for each gallon of gasoline.

* The text describes an aquarium lighting system using LEDs with a housing having a top side and a bottom side, and a lighting control region on the bottom side.
* The lighting control region includes at least two control channels for controlling different colors of light, and a neutral channel. A first light-emitting module is sized and configured to be coupled to the lighting control region and has an LED that emits a first color of light and a first electrical connector that couples to the first control channel. A second light-emitting module is also included and has an LED that emits a second color of light and a second electrical connector that couples to the second control channel.
* The system includes a switch coupled to the housing that is operable to control the first control channel, and the first and second control channels can be controlled independently of each other. The two control channels allow an end user to define a color temperature output of the aquarium.
* The light-emitting modules are releasably coupled to the lighting control region and include a tab that engages a protrusion on the lighting control region. The tab is formed as part of the module and includes a living hinge that allows for movement of the tab with respect to the remainder of the module. When the tab is released, the living hinge biases the tab into engagement with the protrusion to firmly retain the module in the desired position and in electrical contact with one or both of the channels and the neutral channel.
* The system includes a single power cord coupled to the housing to provide electrical power to both the control channel and the control channel. A built-in transformer may also be included in the light element.
* The system may also include a remote control for operating the light-emitting module, and a dual or single in-line timer for controlling the light-emitting module. The system may also include a cabinet and mounting bracket for insertion of the light member.

* The present invention relates to a cooled flow deflection apparatus for a fluid-flow machine operating at high temperatures.
  * Current flow deflection apparatuses, such as stator or rotor blades in a gas turbine, require internal cooling channels to reduce metal temperature.
  * These cooling channels and separating walls are typically cast, leading to disadvantages such as high blade weight, complex casting process, and thermal stresses.
  * The invention proposes to construct separating walls as separate inserts, which are subsequently inserted into the apparatus and secured.
  * This approach results in several advantages, including reduced thermal stresses, simpler casting core, and easier adjustment of the cooling system.
  * A first preferred embodiment is a hollow casting with holders for inserts, while a second preferred embodiment connects inserted separating walls to the flow deflection apparatus by an integral material joint.
  * The invention can be particularly advantageous for rotor blades in gas turbines, which have a complex geometry.
  * In this case, cooling channels and separating walls extend essentially in the radial direction, and the integral material joint is arranged at the end of the separating walls close to the axis.

<summary>
 
* The text describes a system and method for controlling a fuel delivery system in a vehicle, which can be switched between manual and automatic control.
* The system comprises a control unit that receives signals indicating accelerator pedal position and throttle valve position, and processes them to provide a control signal to a DC motor that automatically sets the throttle position for optimum vehicle performance.
* The control unit also provides an output signal that controls a clutch, connecting the accelerator pedal directly to the throttle valve when manual control is desired, allowing the driver full control of the vehicle.
  </summary>

The system is designed to prevent the vehicle from lurching forward or stalling when control is shifted from automatic to manual, and to provide full operation of the vehicle when under manual control. The control system can also be used in conjunction with a system for controlling the operation of a continuously variable transmission. The system may use a stepper motor or a DC motor to control the throttle valve, and the control unit may be programmed to detect the transmission ratio and switch to the optimum control mode for the throttle. The system may also include a logic sequencer and phase drivers to drive the stepper motor.

• The invention is a method and apparatus for generating heat from particulate-laden gas or waste fuels such as wood waste.
• The invention aims to provide a clean burning waste fuel burner that emits minimal quantities of particulate materials and operates producing little slag or clinkers.
• The method forms a conical pile of waste fuel, with preheated underfire air percolating up through the pile in controlled amounts, drying and gasifying the waste fuel in the pile.
• The volatile gases driven off the pile are partially oxidized by additional combustion air in a first combustion chamber, with the total amount of combustion air maintained at less than stoichiometric proportions.
• A swirl air is introduced in an amount necessary to maintain a steady temperature at the exit of the primary chamber and force particulate out of the gas stream.
• The volatile gases move into a second combustion chamber where secondary combustion air is introduced for complete combustion.
• The combustion air introduced to the primary and secondary chambers is introduced on the outside of a refractory lining to cool the lining and increase its life.
• The secondary combustion air introduced in the secondary combustion chamber can be introduced at various axial locations to regulate the position of the flame within the chamber.
• Additional blend air can be added to the discharge of the secondary chamber to cool the air for industrial purposes other than boiler heat.
• The invention can also be used for burning other types of dirty particulate-laden combustible gas and removing the particulate for meeting environmental emission standards.

* The text describes an evaporative cooler system that uses a heat exchanger to separate the evaporating water from the cooling air stream, achieving sensible cooling. The system draws at least a major portion of the working air from the room to be cooled, which has a lower wet bulb temperature than outside air, resulting in a larger temperature differential and more efficient cooling.
* The system includes various air flow paths, such as recirculation of return air to mix with fresh air for quicker cooling (though at a higher energy cost), and bypass of cooled air to mix with the working return air for lower temperatures (also at a higher energy cost). The heat exchanger comprises an array of spaced vertically directed hollow elongated tubular members, with the wet side accomplished by gravity flow of water downwardly along the inner surfaces of the tubes in conjunction with countercurrent flow of returned air from the load, and the dry side accomplished by fresh air flowing in thermal conductive contact with the outer surfaces of the tubular members for cooling.

* The text describes a fluid pump for pumping liquids, particularly liquid manure from animal husbandry operations.
* The pump has multiple pump heads, each containing an impeller driven by a drive structure, and fluid conduits for directing fluid flow.
* The pump heads can be connected in series so that fluid flows from one pump head to the next, with each pump head increasing the pressure of the fluid.
* The drive structure can be powered by a single motor and can include one or more drive shafts on which the impellers are mounted.
* Connectors can be used to connect the drive shafts between pump heads, allowing for the common driving of the impellers.
* The pump can be mounted on a support structure, such as a wheeled boom, hitching assembly, or trailer, for operation at a fluid reservoir.
* The pump is designed to handle high volumes of fluid and high pressures, making it suitable for pumping liquid manure.

• The invention relates to engine compression release brakes, specifically for less than all engine cylinders.
• Traditional systems include an engine brake for each cylinder, but this results in excess components when not all cylinders need to be braked.
• The invention includes an engine with a reduced number of engine compression release brakes, attached to a portion of the engine cylinders.
• The portion of cylinders operated in a braking mode is less than all of the engine cylinders.
• Each engine compression release brake is operably coupled to a cam actuated exhaust valve.
• The engine housing defines the plurality of engine cylinders and the engine compression release brakes are attached to the engine housing.
• The engine compression release brake includes a brake body, an electrical actuator such as a solenoid, a valve member, a spool valve member, a biasing spring, and a piston.
• The spool valve member is movable between an upward, retracted position and a downward, advanced position.
• The piston is movably positioned in the brake body above the rocker arm and provides a hydraulic surface exposed to fluid pressure in the actuation fluid passage.

• The text describes a link assembly between an engine and a gearbox for use in aircraft gas turbine engines.
• The link assembly includes a male link and a female link that can translate relative to each other to form a radial interface that dampens translation.
• A pin releasably couples the male and female links to selectively retain them.
• The female link receives the male link to allow translation and form the radial interface, which dampens translation of the male link relative to the female link.
• The pin is releasably coupled to the male and female links to selectively retain them.
• The link assembly is used in a gearbox assembly that includes a gearbox and supporting elements to secure the gearbox to an engine.
• The gearbox can be an auxiliary gearbox that transmits torque from the engine to peripheral loads.
• The mounting links in the gearbox assembly constrain the gearbox with respect to the engine in all six translational and rotational degrees of freedom, without overconstraining the gearbox.
• The illustrated embodiment includes a pin that can shear under extreme loads to allow a permitted range of motion between the engine and the gearbox.
• The interface between the female link and the male link dampens the relative motion within the permitted range of motion, allowing the mounting link to absorb extreme shocks.

* The text describes an invention related to archery equipment that improves the attachment of arrow points and nocks to arrow shafts and balances arrow shafts. The invention includes a point cap system with a point cap and a balance pin, which can be adjusted in weight for perfect balance. The design works together to attach points to arrow shafts without allowing dirt to enter the shaft when the arrow points are not attached. The threads receiving the arrow point are placed on a point cap member, and the means of attachment is suited to the use of unidirectional fiber reinforced shafts.
* The invention also includes a point adaptor adhesively attached to the arrow shaft and having internal threads for threaded receipt of various types of arrow points having external threads. A nock cap adaptor is also included for attaching nocks to the end of an arrow shaft. The balance pin's weight can be adjusted to balance an arrow shaft.
* The point cap is made from a hardened steel and is permanently attached to the arrow shaft, providing additional support to the end of the arrow shaft. The point adaptor is made of a light material such as aluminum and is attached to the arrow shaft by an adhesive. The nock cap is preferably made of a light material such as aluminum and is attached to the arrow shaft by an adhesive. The balance pin is affixed to the arrow shaft by insertion into the arrow shaft without necessitating the use of a threaded arrow shaft.

• The Small Arms Firing Effect Simulator (SAFES) is an electronically controlled pyrotechnic sound and flash simulator for use with small arms training.
• It utilizes a low-cost plastic expendable housing a metal/oxidizer pyrotechnic in conjunction with an electrical ignition system, and can be installed in a firing unit which can be inserted into the weapon via the magazine breech.
• The SAFES produces sound and flash by the electrical ignition of the pyrotechnic in a confined space and venting the combustion produced in a manner which utilizes the weapon's ejection port.
• The electrical control circuit provides for automatic and semiautomatic fire, and interfaces with the weapon trigger and bolt.
• The SAFES is designed to provide a realistic simulation of small arms fire noise and flash, and is a cost-effective and reliable means to provide realistic training using an actual weapon.
• The SAFES is also designed to provide a pyrotechnic simulation of small arms fire without dangerous pressuration of the ignition chamber.

• The present invention is an air intake device for an internal combustion engine, comprising a tank, a first pipe with a larger cross-sectional area, and a second pipe with a smaller cross-sectional area, both interconnecting the tank and the air intake passage at different locations. A valve and valve actuating means are also included in the first passage.
• The device aims to improve engine performance by utilizing the dynamic effect of air flow, while reducing noise from the air intake. The smaller cross-sectional area of the second passage absorbs noise, creating a resonator effect.
• The control valve is controlled based on engine load and speed conditions, with the valve preferably closed when the load is below a certain line and opened only in specific engine speed and load regions.
• The engine load can be detected by the position of the throttle valve or the vacuum level in the intake manifold. The valve operating conditions are stored in the control circuit, which produces a control signal for the solenoid valve and the control valve.

• The text describes a two-part bracket system for mounting speakers or other equipment to various surfaces or structures. The system comprises a stationary bracket and an adjustable bracket, which can be connected together to mount the equipment to a surface or pole. The system is designed for one person to install and is resistant to weather, wind, and vibration.

• The system includes a pole clamp assembly for use on poles and the like, which consists of adapter brackets with stepped teeth for an ideal fit on cylinders and a length of link chain with threaded J-hooks at each end. This combination of components fits a wide variety of pole shapes and sizes, produces excellent resistance to rotation, and reduces the likelihood of over tensioning. The stationary mounting bracket is directly secured to the pole via the chain, hooks, and wing nuts, with the adapters trapped in between, providing 360 degrees of horizontal adjustment.

* The text describes a modular burner system for heat-utilizing appliances, with a burner having a combustion chamber enclosed by an outer wall and a shroud providing a second wall. The system includes legs, an ash pan, and a perforate food grate, and is designed for efficient, clean burning and interchangeable use with diverse appliances.
* The burner has a fuel holder surrounded by an outer wall, with air flowing both through the fuel holder for initial combustion and around the holder for secondary combustion. A shroud surrounds the outer wall, establishing a flow path for tertiary combustion air and providing a cool exterior surface.
* The system includes manual couplings for removably attaching modular heat-utilizing appliances, such as closed and open cookers, a food smoker, a space heater, and a pyrolyzer. The burner is designed to optimize efficiency, limit unburned fuel emissions, and accommodate diverse appliances.
* The burner includes an air inlet opening, a constricted exhaust outlet, and a perforate receptacle enabling air to support combustion of solid fuel. The outer shroud constrains air flow and interposes a thermally insulating barrier between the housing and exterior of the burner.
* An ash pan is releasably coupled to the burner below the fuel holder, forming a sump capable of storing water to extinguish burning embers.
