The ash pan may serve as an air damper by virtue of its degree of inclination, and a hook and multiple position catch may be employed to secure the ash pan in any one of several degrees of inclination.

<summary>
 
* The text discusses the problem of in-line spark plugs in a rotary internal combustion engine and their effect on cooling flow and heat transfer.
* The invention proposes a staggered arrangement of spark plug bosses to improve coolant performance and reduce locally high thermal conditions.
* The staggered arrangement provides separate paths for vapor release during boiling heat transfer and improves the distribution of coolant velocities around the boss surface.
* The rotary engine comprises a housing, rotor, induction system, ignition system, cooling passageway, and boss means for containing the ignition means within the water passageway.
* The spark plugs are arranged at stations on opposite sides of the minor axis and have terminal portions with appropriate lead-in electrical wires for carrying a pulse of energy to excite sparks.
* The cooling passage extends from an entrance into the housing to an exiting station and has a wall separating the trochoid chamber from the cooling passage with a predetermined thickness.
* The boss means comprises two cylindrically shaped and cast bosses that extend across the passageway at a location adjacent the vertically rising section of the flow.
* The bosses are arranged to effect a definite and noticeable offset arrangement in the passage, and the terminals of each spark plug project onto a point on the trochoid wall preferably offset a distance.
</summary>

• The invention describes a method for minimizing flow disturbance caused by the closing and reopening of turbine control valves during periodic operational testing.
• The method uses control valve positions as feedback to maintain constant total mass flow through several parallel turbine inlet flow control valves, which in turn maintains constant steam generator pressure and minimizes turbine power changes.
• The flow difference between the N and N-1 condition is determined during the turbine design process and applied to the total flow demand to each of the N-1 valves on the basis of the total N valve demand derived from the position of the valve under test.
• The method does not require the monitoring of additional process parameters, resulting in improved performance.
• The use of the control valve test compensating control of the present invention reduced the pressure excursion of the turbine inlet main (throttle) steam pressure by 95%.

• The invention is a mixing valve for an aircraft cleaning apparatus with two inlets and one outlet, allowing for a solution mixture ranging from 0% of one fluid to 100% of the other fluid.
• The system aims to provide individual users with control over the cleaning solution strength, allowing for a constant pressure cleaning solution with an adjustable cleaning agent to water ratio.
• The valve system includes a valve body, a first inlet passage for a first fluid, a second inlet passage for a second fluid, an outlet passage, and a valve means for directing the fluids toward the outlet passage.
• The valve means is adjustable to permit the mixture to range between 0% first fluid, 100% second fluid to 100% second fluid, 0% first fluid.
• The system comprises a spool valve, flow restricting device, and retaining screw to control the fluid flow and maintain constant fluid pressures.
• The valve system allows for continuous analog control of the proportional quantities of soap solution and water.
• Two inherent mechanisms maintain constant fluid pressures at the inlet passages and enable multiple identical valve systems to operate from a common soap solution source and common water source.

- The invention describes a method and arrangement for compressing and cooling natural gas in a compressor station for a gas pipeline, particularly in permanent frost areas. The method involves compressing the gas to a higher pressure, cooling it by heat exchange, and then feeding it back into the pipeline at a lower temperature and increased pressure.
- The invention proposes a new way of cooling the compressed gas during the warmer months using the Joule-Thomson effect, which cools a gas when it is expanded to a lower pressure. This eliminates the need for expensive re-cooling plants with separate cooling cycles that use propane as a cooling agent.
- The proposed method can reduce investments and operation risks by utilizing the known physical effect that a compressed gas is inevitably cooled when expanded to a lower pressure. This is achieved by compressing the gas to an excess pressure, cooling it by heat exchange, and then expanding it to the desired exit pressure.
- The invention also provides a more significant cooling effect and energy recovery by utilizing an expansion turbine to expand the compressed gas and recover mechanical energy for providing a portion of the drive energy for the compression of the gas to the intended excess pressure.

* Electronic components produce heat when operating, and in many applications, free convection cooling is not sufficient to prevent overheating.
* Electric fans are often used to move air across electronic components to keep them within acceptable temperature ranges, and are typically secured to enclosures using fasteners such as screws or dowel pins.
* The document describes a system for eliminating the need for fasteners when securing cooling fans to enclosures, which can reduce costs and labor.
* The system includes a motor with a non-rotatable housing and mounting legs, and a panel with recess portions and openings of varying sizes.
* The motor carrier and mounting legs are designed to fit into the recess portions and openings on the panel, and spring members urge the motor carrier away from the panel to prevent it from becoming disengaged.
* The process of installing the cooling fan assembly involves positioning it against the panel, applying a compressive and rotating force to move it into place, and allowing the resilient leg portions to spring outward and capture each leg portion pair within its respectively associated residual opening.
* The spring member remains in a compressed state, urging the turned-out portions of the resilient leg portions against the exterior surface of the panel, which helps to prevent vibrational noise and vibrational forces from causing the resilient leg portions to become disengaged.

- Spacecraft structures, including instruments mounted on precision kinematic mounts (KM), may experience high vibration levels during flight due to the lightweight and low damping characteristics of composite materials used in their construction. This can lead to instrument failure and mission loss.
- The present invention aims to improve the performance of kinematic mounts by incorporating damping features, specifically a passive energy dissipating mechanism to protect the instrument from potentially damaging flight loads. This can be achieved while maintaining the mount's strength, stiffness, and kinematic features.
- The damping mechanism can be introduced at flexural hinge locations of the mounts, where the most active portion of the mounts occurs. This can be done using local dampers, such as a spherical damper or a cylindrical slot damper, which can dissipate vibration energy in the form of heat.
- The unique frequency-dependent properties of certain space-qualified viscoelastic materials make them viable candidates for damping kinematic mounts during flight, as they can reduce the added damper stiffness in the thermal load regime, which is typically a small fraction of a Hertz.

- The invention describes an oil shear type clutch unit for large power transmission requirements, specifically for an aircraft catapult system. It aims to overcome disadvantages of previously known constructions, such as maximizing application of forces to couple the plates and discs, minimizing residual drag, and maintaining high control accuracy.
- The clutch unit comprises an input shaft, an output shaft, a plurality of clutch plates connected to one of the shafts, a plurality of clutch discs interleaved between the clutch plates and connected to the other shaft, and separate means for closing the gap between each clutch disc and its adjacent clutch plates. The means includes piston and cylinder means connected to the clutch plates on opposite sides of each clutch disc, and fluid pressure control means for simultaneously supplying pressurized fluid in parallel to all of the piston and cylinder means.
- The clutch discs are made up of a plurality of arcuate segments in a circumferential arrangement, with each segment having longitudinally extending supporting means and co-acting portions on the supporting means and the edges of the clutch disc segments for holding the segments in position. The segments can be removed separately for replacement without disturbing the other segments.
- The invention also includes a servo control valve and fluid amplifiers for providing extremely accurate fluid pressure control in response to various conditions, such as wind and temperature conditions and the type of aircraft being launched.

• The text describes an engine system with multiple cylinders, including combustion cylinders and expansion cylinders, which work together to improve efficiency and reduce emissions.
• The system includes a water injection process that cools exhaust gases and helps drive the expansion cylinders, and can also include a multi-stage cascade of expansion cylinders to recapture heat and energy.
• The system aims to minimize heat loss and eliminate the need for a radiator, and can include a water cooling system, water recovery system, and catalytic conversion system to further improve efficiency and reduce emissions.

1. The invention describes a method for fabricating steel plates or blanks with good mechanical strength, high impact resistance, and good corrosion resistance for use in the automotive industry. The method involves coating steel plates with an aluminum or aluminum alloy layer, heating the coating to form a surface alloy by interdiffusion, and heat treating the plates to obtain parts with a tensile strength greater than 1500 MPa.
2. The invention can also be applied to the fabrication of butt-welded blanks, which are steel blanks of different compositions or thicknesses continuously butt-welded together. Laser beam welding is used to assemble the blanks, which allows for flexibility, quality, and productivity. The heat treatment process can be adapted to produce parts with varying mechanical strength, pressability, and impact absorption properties.
3. However, the fabrication method can encounter difficulties when welding coated steel blanks, as the initial surface pre-coating can be transferred into the molten area created by the welding operation. This can lead to the formation of intermetallic areas, which can reduce the overall deformability of the welded joints and lead to the onset of rupture under static or dynamic conditions.
4. The invention aims to solve this problem by proposing a fabrication process that prevents the formation of intermetallic areas within welded assemblies, resulting in parts with good corrosion resistance and satisfactory ductility (total elongation across the welded joint greater than or equal to 4%).
5. The invention involves the use of a plate consisting of a steel substrate and a precoat, which includes a layer of intermetallic alloy in contact with the substrate and topped by a layer of metal alloy. The metal alloy layer is removed from at least one precoated face of the plate in an area situated at the periphery of the plate. The precoat is preferably an alloy of aluminum or based on aluminum, and the metal alloy layer preferably comprises 8-11% silicon, 2-4% iron, and the remainder aluminum and inevitable impurities. The width of the area from which the metal alloy layer has been removed is preferably between 0.2 and 2.2 mm. The area from which the metal all

* The present invention is a continuation of U.S. patent application Ser. No. 11/942,576, entitled "Supervisory Control and Data Acquisition System for Energy Extracting Vessel Navigation."
* The invention is a remote control system for the operation and navigation of a mobile structure that optimally recovers energy from an offshore marine environment.
* The system is designed to overcome the limitations of stationary energy recovery systems and improve efficiency by accounting for data from weather observations and sensors on the mobile structure.
* The system is particularly useful for navigating a sailing vessel optimized to reduce drag while responding to wind and water velocity vectors by adjusting points of sail, rudder rotation, openness of turbine gates, and ballast draft.
* The SCADA system includes computer servers that gather data through diverse means such as GPS systems, weather satellite systems, and geographic and weather data resources.
* The system is not limited to implementation of the Turbine-Integrated Hydrofoil system of U.S. Pat. No. 7,298,056 and can be used for remote control of any system that exploits energy from weather patterns.
* The system can also be used for logistics-only purposes past weather patterns, using just the path cost algorithm without weighing energy extraction yield factors into the cost of travel.
* The system comprises an algorithm that optimizes energy extraction using yield functions derived from weather and geospatial data and vessel performance models.
* The system includes a graphical user interface on a client computer system that allows remote humans to interact and choose mission critical navigation plans.

- The invention describes a rolling body guide cage and a method for manufacturing it, which aims to reduce production costs.
* The guide cage is made from a ring element with an axial profiling and several guide structures for rolling bodies.
* The ring element is produced from at least two flat material ring segments joined in the circumferential direction.
* The flat material ring segments are welded together before the formation of the axial profiling.
* This design reduces cutting waste and is particularly cost-effective for large-diameter guide cages.
* The flat material ring segments can be punched out from a sheet metal material, preferably as 120° segments, and welded together with a small number of weld points.
* The guide cage can be used for radial and axial bearing cages, including groove and angular ball bearings.
* The ring elements can be produced using a rotary plate and a welding station, with the possibility of overlapping the punching and welding steps.
* The weld points can be formed using laser welding or pressure welding, with the option of adding welding material.
* The ring segments can be punched out with a material bead near the edge for a high-quality weld connection.

- The text describes methods and systems for obtaining and processing information related to customer service locations in a telecommunications network. This includes using global satellite positioning (GPS) to acquire latitude and longitude coordinates of service locations, and storing this information in databases associated with customer records and address guides. 
- The text also discusses a system for generating travel directions between customer service locations, using GPS to obtain coordinates of the "from" and "to" locations, and a mapping system to generate driving directions based on these coordinates.

* The invention relates to a system for compensating electromagnetic interfering fields, specifically for magnetic field compensation with two sensors and a digital processor.
  * Feedback control systems are commonly used for magnetic field compensation, with sensors measuring the amplitude of interfering fields in three dimensions.
  * Magnetic field compensation systems are used in imaging systems with magnetic fields, such as scanning electron microscopes.
  * Compensation fields should be homogeneous if interfering fields are homogeneous, and pairs of Helmholtz coils are often used to generate homogeneous compensation fields.
  * A device for compensating magnetic fields is disclosed in U.S. Publication No 2005/019555A1, using three coil pairs and an analog controller.
  * Systems may also use only one coil per space axis for compensation, but the compensation region is smaller than with Helmholtz coils.
  * A single magnetic field sensor is typically used for measuring the magnetic field, but this does not allow for detecting homogeneity or inhomogeneity of the magnetic field.
  * Problems arise when compensating electromagnetic interfering fields, such as the inability to measure the interfering field directly at the location to be protected, potential feedback effects between compensation systems, and the difficulty of optimizing control systems for different applications.
  * The invention provides a system with two real triaxial magnetic field sensors, three pairs of compensation coils, and a control unit to protect an object from interfering fields.
  * The system combines the six output signals of the two real sensors into three output signals of a virtual sensor, allowing for homogeneous and inhomogeneous magnetic field compensation, simulation of measuring electromagnetic interfering fields, and equalization of feedback effects between compensation systems.

- The text describes a method for investigating a sample derived from a biological source using CARS (Coherent Anti-Stokes Raman Scattering) microscopy, which involves the use of laser irradiation to excite resonance sites in the sample and generate a resonance signal. The method aims to improve CARS microscopy by furnishing at least one resonance site in the sample using a bioorthogonal reaction of an intrinsic chemical structure of the sample with at least one reaction partner.
- The bioorthogonal reaction can be used to introduce a resonance site that is not inherently contained in the sample, allowing for the detection of structures that do not have sufficient resonance sites or do not exhibit the desired localization or specificity. The method can also be used to highlight or make visible chemical structures that are not normally detectable by CARS microscopy. The use of bioorthogonal reactions allows for the introduction of small molecules that can diffuse through tissue, enabling three-dimensional image production by CARS microscopy.

* The text describes a system and method for assessing the quality of medical segmentations, which are used in radiation therapy to guide the alignment and intensity of radiation beams.
* The system compares two or more electronic segmentation files providing segmentations for the same structure from different sources, such as a "gold standard" segmentation prepared by an experienced clinician and a segmentation by a less experienced clinician or an autosegmentation program.
* The system displays the segmentations on a graphics display screen in spatial alignment on cross-sectional display, with the segmentation of the first file displayed in a solid line and the segmentation of the second file displayed in a dotted line superimposed thereupon.
* The system identifies "missing" volume elements in the second segmentation that are not in the first segmentation, "extra" volume elements that are found in the first segmentation but not in the second, and "common" volume elements that are found in both segmentations.
* The system determines a scalar distance between each given volume element in either of the missing or extra volume elements and the closest volume element in the common volume elements.
* The system provides a different treatment of one or more of these volume elements and scalar distances through various measurement metrics, such as linear or exponential weighting as a function of distance.
* The system allows custom entry of metric methods through a formula parameter table and a formula graph, where the user can develop their own formulas and name them with a text string.
* The system voxelizes the segmentations, which involves converting the segmentations into a voxel model conforming generally to the bounded volume.
* The system adjusts the voxel models for any origin offsets previously entered by the user, and compares the voxel models for the segmentations to characterize each of the voxels as common, missing, or extra and determine the scalar distances.

* The text describes a method and apparatus for accelerating the execution of floating point operations in data processing systems.
 
 * The floating point format represents numerical quantities using a fraction value and an exponent value, with the advantage of a wider range of representable numbers compared to the standard data format.
 
 * However, addition and subtraction operations in the floating point format are more complex and time-consuming due to the need for fraction alignment and normalization.
 
 * The text proposes a technique for accelerating the effective subtraction operation by using a subset of the operand exponent arguments to begin the subtraction of differences between operand fractions before the complete difference between the exponent arguments is determined.
 
 * The method involves determining the difference between a subset of the operand exponent arguments and initiating subtraction of differences between operand fractions (or fractional portions thereof) based on the subset difference.
 
 * The procedures are chosen such that when the complete operand argument difference is different from the subset operand argument difference, the correct result fraction is available.
 
 * The apparatus implementing the method includes a floating point execution unit with apparatus for determining the difference between operand exponential arguments and apparatus for determining the difference between a subset of the operand exponent arguments.

• The present invention is a method and system for tracking a specimen acquired from a patient, designed to reduce or avoid mislabeling of specimen vials.
• The method involves storing machine-readable codes associated with the patient, order, specimen-taker, and specimen container in a computer storage, and generating signals to acquire a specimen and place it in the container.
• The system includes a standalone or networked computer, computer storage, and an electronic reading means for reading unique machine-readable codes disposed on an ID means worn by a patient, an order to obtain the specimen, an ID means worn by a specimen-taker, and a specimen container.
• The electronic reading means dispatches the machine-readable codes to the processor, which stores the machine-readable code for each specimen container in a relational manner with the machine-readable codes for the patient ID means, the order, and the specimen-taker ID means.
• The computer is responsive to a signal that a specimen has been placed in a container for storing an indication thereof in the computer storage in a relational manner with the machine-readable code for each specimen container that received the specimen.
• Each specimen container has a machine-readable code preapplied thereon that is unique from the machine-readable code preapplied to any other of the specimen containers.
• The method can further include determining if a specimen container is out-of-date based on the expiration date encoded in the machine-readable code, and generating an alert signal if the specimen container is out-of-date.

• The invention is a voice-activated distance measuring device, such as for golf, that uses GPS technology and voice recognition technology to provide distance and other information to the user in a verbal, electronically spoken form.
• The electronics and software for the device can be incorporated into an article of clothing or other portable device, such as a hat or visor.
• The device uses commercially available golf course mapping data to convert GPS longitude and latitude coordinates to measure distance and other factors.
• The device incorporates voice recognition technology to accept voice commands from the user and voice synthesis technology to provide an audible output of distance and other information.
• Additional features include the ability to memorize and compute user input to predict golf strategy, club selection, and other golf player needs, as well as the ability to upload and download data to a separate computer for various detailed functions.
• The device may also be used for other applications, such as hiking, surveying, hunting, and scuba diving, and can be expanded to include any portable application.

* The present invention is a design rule checking system and method that accurately reports appropriate errors for appropriate regions in a system that includes two different kinds of circuits, i.e., such as memory and logic.
* The invention eliminates false errors caused by design rule checking tools examining regions that are not subject to the same design rules supported by the design rule-checking tool.
* The method helps users filter out false errors due to logic rule checks in a memory block, and further helps pinpoint real design rule errors in the mask pattern data.
* The invention also covers the creation of customized rules appropriate for different types of memory regions that might be included on a chip, where such customized rules are based on modifying a standard logic rule by “pushing” more liberal memory based parameter on to a stricter logic based parameter.
* The invention can be executed on any number of conventional computing systems for creating such customized rules, and/or for performing a design rule check on mask pattern data based on such customized rule sets.
* The system is configured with the above mentioned customized design rules and programs executing on a conventional computer system.
* The results are categorized in different categories in accordance with where they occur, such as in Logic, Bordered Single Port (BDSP) SRAM, Borderless Single Port (BLSP) SRAM, Dual Port (DP) SRAM and ROM groups. Furthermore it will more accurately detect and classify mistakes or any modifications made to standardized foundry bit cell designs as may be made by memory compiler vendors or layout engineers at the IC designer.

• The invention is related to the use of waveguide holograms (WGH) for controlled illumination of objects with specific illumination requirements, such as display holograms or spatial light modulators (SLMs).
• The WGHs are based on thin substrate waveguides, which are optically coupled to a coherent light source, such as a laser. These waveguides are characterized by the relationship between the width w of an incident laser beam coupled onto an optical waveguide having a thickness t, controlled by λ, the wavelength of the incident lightwave.
• Thin substrate waveguides are characterized by t>>λ, which allows for convenient white light illumination and uniform illumination, avoiding difficulties encountered in coupling the optical source to the thin film waveguide.
• The WGHs can be used to selectively illuminate demanding objects, such as holograms and SLMs, by compensating for non-uniformity of the diffracted wavefront in the direction of propagation through exposing a photographic emulsion to the beam without compensation or recording the hologram of the WGH non-uniformly.
• The WGH illuminator occupies much less space compared to a conventional lens illumination system and can achieve very high diffraction efficiency, while eliminating stray light propagating forward the observer.
• However, there are some penalties to be paid, such as critical alignment of the laser beam, time delay across the hologram, and nonuniformity of the diffracted wavefront along the propagation direction. These issues can be addressed through various compensation methods and design considerations.

* The text describes a method and apparatus for non-destructive testing of dynamoelectric machine rotors, such as those used in electric motors and generators. The method and apparatus are used to measure the resistance, reactance, and effective electrical skew of the rotor to identify defects.
* The apparatus includes a test head with a core of magnetic material and a set of primary windings that form at least one pair of poles. The test head also includes a set of voltage sensing pick-up coils and a skew sensing pick-up coil to generate voltage and skew signals, respectively. A current sensor is used to sense the current provided to energize the test heads.
* The system also includes a data acquisition and processing circuit that controls the acquisition of test data and processes the data to produce useful test results and rotor pass/fail determinations. The data acquisition and processing circuit includes a data processor and a control processor.
* During a rotor test, the sample and hold circuit simultaneously samples each of the sense signals each time a timing pulse from the phase locked loop occurs. The samples are then multiplexed, digitized, and processed to reduce the data to usable form. The control processor determines the mean resistance, reactance, and effective skew for the rotor, as well as the range of the 40 values for the resistance and effective skew. The calculated values are then compared to predetermined maximum and minimum threshold values to determine if the rotor is good or defective.

* The text describes a method for securing a computing device by granting access to native resources of an operating system to a managed library with a valid digital certificate, and denying access to a managed application with a digital certificate that only authorizes specific native resource access through the managed library.
* The method involves using a manager to authorize requests from managed applications to access native system resources through managed libraries, and using information from digital certificates associated with the managed libraries to determine whether to grant access.
* The method also includes using a runtime host to access native system resources in response to requests from managed libraries, and using native instructions to effectuate the runtime host.
* The method can be used to secure a mobile device by preventing managed applications from accessing native system resources directly, and instead requiring them to access resources through managed libraries with appropriate digital certificates.
* The method can also be used to protect a closed computing device from executing un-trusted instructions by using an arbitration layer to gate access to the operating system and prevent managed applications from invoking native methods or having unrestricted access to memory.

* The invention describes an improved identification card with an internal antenna and integrated circuit chip laminated between two protective, non-rigid layers, which are then laminated between two rigid outer layers.
* The card is designed to protect the electronic components from damage and reduce the complexity and cost of production associated with prior art methods.
* The card is made from a core layer of silica-filled polyolefin, which is pre-shrunk and printed with indicia, antenna, and integrated circuit chip. The core layer is then bonded to a bottom sheet with an adhesive layer and enclosed between two laminate layers.

* The invention describes a method for implementing a FIFO queue in a functional memory using a tree-shaped data structure.
* In functional memories, updates are carried out in such a way that the path from the root of a tree-shaped structure to the point of updating is copied and the update is made in the copied data.
* The tree-shaped data structure used to implement the FIFO queue has nodes with a given maximum size and a hierarchy level. Additions and deletions are directed to specific nodes on the first or opposite edge of the tree.
* The method reduces the amount of required copying in functional structures, as only the path leading from the root to the point of updating must be copied from the structure.
* The queue can be inverted in constant time and space, and an identifier is used to indicate the beginning and end of the queue.
* The invention also describes a preferred embodiment for a header node used in the structure, which comprises three elements that can be empty or contain a pointer to the end, tree-shaped structure, or beginning of the queue.
* Additions and deletions are made in such a way that the node constituting the end is always filled first, and only then is an addition made to the tree-shaped structure.
* A balanced tree structure is used to implement the queue, which meets the balance and fill conditions.
* The tree structure can also be implemented as a mirror image, with additions made on the right-hand edge and deletions on the left-hand edge of the tree.
* A three-element node, called a header node, can be added to the data structure to implement a FIFO queue, with one child forming the leaf node at the end, the second child containing a tree of the kind described above, and the third child forming the leaf node at the beginning of the queue.

1. * The invention provides methods for building embedded EPROM devices using existing IC manufacture technologies, including EPROM devices for DRAM redundancy circuits using existing DRAM technology and EPROM devices manufactured by standard logic technologies that do not require high voltages for operations.
2. * The invention utilizes existing circuit elements such as DRAM storage capacitors as coupling capacitors to build floating gate EPROM devices and uses transistor properties changed under stress conditions to support EPROM operations. The invention also describes the use of "stress effect programmable read only memory" (SEPROM) devices that use electrical stresses on common transistors to store data.

• The text describes a method for determining the optimum value of feedback gain used in feedback control for moving an automatic guidance vehicle (AGV) along a predetermined course.
• The feedback control includes detecting a deviation or error from the course, calculating a correction amount based on the detected error, and correcting the steering angle of the vehicle based on the calculated correction amount.
• The correction amount can be calculated using a P system, PI system, PD system, or PID system, with the values of the P, I, and D gains greatly influencing the feedback control characteristics.
• A limit sensitivity process is mentioned as a prior art technique for determining the optimum value of feedback gain, but it has problems with the practical detection of self-sustaining vibration.
• The proposed method for determining feedback gain involves provisionally determining a predetermined value of feedback gain, executing feedback control using the provisionally determined value, detecting an error between a designated value and an actual value of the subject of control, calculating an evaluation value indicative of the character of feedback control based on the detected error, and repeating the process with a new feedback gain value.
• The evaluation value is calculated differently depending on whether the proportional gain, integral gain, or differential gain is being determined.
• The method allows for the quick and reliable determination of a feedback gain that can realize suitable feedback control characteristics.

• The invention describes a zoom lens with a large relative aperture, high range, and good optical performance, designed to minimize the size of photographic or video camera lenses.
• The zoom lens comprises five lens units, each with specific refractive powers, radii of curvature, and Abbe numbers, arranged to optimize image quality and reduce chromatic aberrations.
• The lens units are designed to satisfy specific conditions that help balance the refractive power, correct aberrations, and minimize size.
• The invention has achieved a significant reduction in the total length of the zoom lens to as short as 9.13φ A to 9.19φ A, making it ideal for compact cameras while preserving high-grade optical performance.

- The invention describes a method and device for detecting elementary particles, such as protons, ions, electrons, neutrons, photons, etc., that can both measure individual particles and integrate count rates.
* The method involves discharging charge pulses or signals from the detector on the low-voltage side, which enables the detection of small-size signals and avoids excessive noise.
* The device includes a detector, a first, fast amplifier for amplifying individual signals, a second, slow amplifier for integrating signals, and a display and/or recording device.
* The first amplifier amplifies individual signals, while the second amplifier integrates signals, and they can be used together or separately depending on the signal rate.
* The device can detect individual particles and their sequences or pulses over time and use an integration of particles when exceeding a count rate or signal rate to maintain a result averaged over an extended period.
* The invention improves upon existing methods and devices that require prior knowledge of possible frequencies or signal rates to perform a detection of individual particles or integrate signals.
* The invention can be used in various applications, such as X-ray detectors, CT scanners, particle accelerators, reactor installations, and diagnostic devices.
* The invention can detect particles over very wide ranges of possible signal or count rates and enable fast charge transport at room temperature, making it suitable for high count or signal rates and high time resolution.

• The invention is an apparatus for automatically spin checking driven disc assemblies used in friction clutches.
• The apparatus includes an enclosure with a stationary and movable ring, a torque motor, and a hub for mounting the driven disc assembly.
• The movable ring is moved toward the stationary ring to frictionally engage the driven disc assembly, and the distance between the rings is measured.
• The torque motor exerts a predetermined torque on the driven disc assembly, attempting to rotate it against the frictional force generated by the rings.
• The movable ring is gradually moved away from the stationary ring, reducing the frictional force on the driven disc assembly.
• When the frictional force has decreased enough, the driven disc assembly rotates, and the distance between the rings is measured again.
• The difference between the two distances is compared with a standard value to determine if the driven disc assembly is excessively warped.
• The apparatus operates automatically without manual involvement and generates an external indication to the operator of whether the driven disc assembly is good or bad.
• The apparatus can store measurements for statistical process control.

• The text describes a face age-estimation system and method that uses a contourlet appearance model (CAM) algorithm to extract feature vectors from face images.
• The CAM algorithm is used to generate a statistical model of appearance that combines a modified active shape model (MASM) and a quasi-localized texture model.
• The MASM represents the facial structure, while the texture model represents the pattern of contourlet-based intensities (skin texture) across a facial image patch.
• The CAM algorithm is robust against noise and can extract more robust facial features that encode age information compared to other facial feature extraction methods.
• The feature vectors are used to train an age classifier and two aging functions using support vector regression (SVR) and support vector machines (SVMs).
• The age classifier is capable of distinguishing between youths and adults, while the aging functions model the growth and development of young people and the aging of adults.
• In the testing phase, the CAM algorithm is used to extract a feature vector from a test image, which is then used to estimate the age of the individual in the image.
• The estimated age is provided in the form of a single age or age indicator, which may be optionally provided with a corresponding confidence factor.
• The system and method can be implemented on a computing system with a processor, memory, and storage device.

• The invention relates to a matrix display device for displaying two merged images, aiming to best preserve the definition of the image with higher definition.
• The device comprises a controller and a matrix of pixels organized in a mosaic of identical arrangements of pixels, with some pixels dedicated to the display of a first image and others dedicated to the display of a second image.
• The controller produces display light intensity signals for each pixel, and the merged display of the two images is produced by the matrix display device, with the images being redimensioned if necessary.
• The pixels dedicated to the display of the first image can emit a single color, while the pixels dedicated to the display of the second image can emit a different single color.
• The controller can apply attenuation functions to the light intensity signals for certain pixels, depending on the quantified values of the signals.
• The invention can be applied to various fields, such as the display of images produced by night vision sensors, infrared sensors, X-ray imaging sensors, echography sensors, or monochrome or two-color symbology images.

• The text describes a mobile identification transmitter used for activating a security system in a motor vehicle, which can also serve as a payment element for electronic transactions.
• The payment element can be removed from the housing of the identification transmitter and used for payment functions, while the identification transmitter can still be used to activate the security system of the motor vehicle.
• The payment element can communicate with an electronic payment system, and can have a credit card function and/or a debit card function.
• The mobile identification transmitter has electronics that can communicate with the communication means on board the motor vehicle for the purpose of activating the security system.
• The payment element is inserted into a receptacle in the housing of the identification transmitter and is held in place by a carrier that is matched to the geometry of the receptacle. A closure can be used to protect the payment element and the contact elements in the receptacle when the payment element is removed.

• The text describes an imaging device, such as a xerographic machine, that becomes inactive when not in use and enters sleep mode to save energy.
• The toner used in the device has a tribo-electro-static charge that affects image quality. If the device is inactive for a long time, the tribo charge of the toner may decrease, leading to inconsistent and darker image quality after a delay.
• To address this issue, various exemplary embodiments propose methods for charging the toner to a predetermined level based on the period of inactivity.
• The charging methods include determining one or more periods of inactivity, measuring the toner charge level when the machine recovers from inactivity, and charging the toner to a predetermined level based on the difference between the measured charge and a predetermined level.
• The charging methods may be included in a xerographic machine and use an inactivity determining section and a charging section.
• The text also describes the structure of an exemplary printing device, including a photoreceptor belt, a charging station, an imaging and exposure station, a developer station, a transfer station, a fusing station, and a cleaning station.
• The developer station includes a developer housing holding toner and a developer, which are mixed in the developer housing.
• The developer housing includes a developer roller, a transport roller, a paddle wheel conveyor, and a toner concentration sensor (TC sensor) to monitor the concentration of the mixed toner and developer.
• The controller of the machine includes an inactivity determining section, a predicting section, a measuring section, a calculating section, an updating section, a storing section, a charging section, and a performing section. These sections work together to determine the inactivity, predict the next user usage, measure the sensor level, calculate the decay of the tribo charge, update and store information, charge the toner to a predetermined level, and perform a printing operation.

• The invention describes a rotary magnetic head type apparatus that permits independent and precise regulation of bias currents supplied to plural MR heads mounted on a rotary drum in a simple structure. This is achieved by providing a control signal generator on a stationary drum side for generating control signals for controlling the operating amperages of magneto resistive heads and a decoder circuit and a current supply circuit on the rotary drum side for controlling the MR heads in response to the output signals of the decoder circuit. The control signals are transmitted over a single channel of a rotary transformer and set the operating currents of the magneto resistive heads.
• The invention also describes a recording/reproducing apparatus that permits switching over among plural heads with high precision, in particular a rotary magnetic head type apparatus that permits switching over plural MR heads and recording heads mounted on a rotary drum at high speed. This is achieved by providing a recording/reproducing unit for recording/reproducing signals onto/from a recording medium with plural heads, a generating unit for generating control data for controlling the recording/reproducing unit, and a transmitting unit for transmitting control data generated by the generating unit to the recording/reproducing unit, wherein data for controlling the switching over among the plurality of heads are transmitted with priority over other control data.
• The invention also describes a method for controlling the operating mode of a regenerative integrated circuit in a rotary magnetic head type apparatus. The operating mode is controlled with data on three control lines including Data, Clock and CS lines. The control functions include head (amplifier) switching, MR head bias current setting, regenerative amplifier gain setting, detection of thermal asperity (TA) noise peculiar to MR heads and correction. A register matching each function is selected in advance, and control data are written into it to determine its operating state and value. By controlling the operating mode in this way, each of the MR heads can be controlled fully independently of each other.

* The text describes an invention for locating and tracing concealed elongated conductive objects, such as pipes or cables, with improved accuracy in the presence of adjacent objects.
* The invention uses a system with a transmitter and receiver, where the transmitter induces distinguishable alternating currents in the objects and the receiver senses the magnetic fields associated with the currents and produces an output signal dependent on both fields.
* The method involves producing distinguishable alternating currents in the objects, moving a receiver sensitive to the magnetic fields associated with the currents, and producing an output signal from the receiver dependent on both fields.
* The invention produces distinct output signal nulls over the respective cables, making it easier to locate and trace one or both cables.
* The system can use different carrier frequencies, amplitude modulation, or pulse rates to distinguish the currents in the respective cables and produce an output signal dependent on both currents.
* The invention is especially useful in environments where the horizontal separation between the cables is related to the depth of the cable to be located and traced, and the field from the transmitter decreases by the inverse cube of the distance between the antenna and the cable.

• The text describes an apparatus for interfacing a speaker phone with a telephone network to permit hands-free automatic answering and communication.
• The invention includes a timer for controlling the length of time of the interconnection and a bypass switch for bypassing the timer.
• The system is designed to be portable, readily connectable, and capable of being moved to various telephone jack locations throughout a particular installation.
• The system includes an optically coupled circuit or a neon lamp optically coupled with a photocell to automatically couple the telephone network to the speaker device in response to the telephone ringing signal.
• The system includes a timing and extension feature to limit the time duration during which the telephone network is coupled to the speaker phone.

* The text describes a system for reducing or eliminating undersea optical repeaters in a trunk and branch ring network by replacing repeaters with remotely pumped optical amplifiers and supplying energy to those optical amplifiers over the same branch cables that also distribute communications signals.
* The system includes an optical fiber cable trunk configured in a ring topology with one or more telecommunications hubs and branching units interconnected serially.
* Each branching unit is connected to a branch fiber optic cable, which is optically coupled at its other end to a cable station that accesses one or more of the signal wavelengths transported along the cable trunk.
* The branch fiber optic cable is used to unidirectionally transmit optical energy at a wavelength other than that of signal wavelength to power an optical amplifier located in the branch fiber optic cable, the optical fiber cable trunk, or the branching unit.
* The hub is an access point to the optical fiber cable trunk by a major switching office, such as a regional switching office, which routes communications onto or from the cable trunk.
* The system can be applied to other methods of signal multiplexing and may also be used as a terrestrial communications system instead of in an undersea application.
* The system has several advantages, including maintaining full connectivity along the trunk and to all cable stations via their respective branch fiber optic cables in the event of a single optical fiber cable trunk cut, isolating the associated cable station without compromising ring integrity in the event of a branch fiber optic cable cut, respecting sovereignty concerns, accommodating reconfigurable wavelength add/drop branching units, and reducing capital and operating and maintenance costs of communications networks.

<summary>

- The invention describes a two-part cover plate device for wall-mounted electrical wiring devices that can be quickly installed and removed using simple tools and available fasteners. The device has an attachment member that is installed over a wiring device and mounted to it, and a cover plate member that latches onto the attachment member without visible fasteners. The cover plate member has saw-tooth shaped racks that receive in locking engagement the associated latching pawls of the attachment member, allowing for accommodation of variations in wall flatness or evenness.
- The device can be used with a single wiring device or multiple wiring devices installed in ganged boxes. The attachment plate has apertures that are complementary with the profile of the wiring device, and latching pawls that engage the saw-tooth shaped racks on the inner surfaces of the cover plate. The cover plate has a slot that provides access to a tab, allowing for the cover plate to be pried off the attachment plate using a small flat tool.

</summary>

* The present invention is a collapsible light-shielding device for a screen, which consists of a number of annular strips concentrically nested and essentially enclosing one another in a tight manner. The strips can be fixed in front of a displaying screen and surround the screen, sliding over one another between a pushed-in position and a pushed-out position. This allows the device to fold around the displaying screen and take up little space when not in use.
 * The annular strips have a decreasing wall thickness, viewed in the axial direction, allowing the device to be set to various angular positions relative to the screen and enabling viewing of the displaying screen from different angles. The device can be easily attached to a monitor using an adapter member and can be produced using solid strips or bent plate material with integrated hook or locking elements.

- The invention aims to improve understanding between speakers and listeners by automatically informing the speaker to decrease their speaking rate when it exceeds a rate that the listener can comprehend.
- This is accomplished by determining the speaking rate for the speaker and comparing it against a speaking rate threshold, which can be based on the listener's proficiency with the language being spoken.
- The system can be implemented as a wearable device, such as a smartphone, that can vibrate, blink, produce speech, or provide other indicators to notify the speaker to decrease their speaking rate.
- The system can also include a microphone, a sensory mechanism, a speaking rate processor, a language detector, a speech clarity processor, a comprehension comparator, and a wireless transceiver.
- The method for automatically notifying the speaker to decrease their speaking rate includes identifying a discourse, detecting the language being spoken, determining the listener's identity or profiling the listener to estimate a listening rate, setting a speaking rate threshold, determining the speaking rate for the speaker, adjusting the speaking rate based on speaking clarity, and notifying the speaker to reduce their speaking rate if it exceeds the speaking rate threshold.

- The invention describes a device for the optical recording of rapid processes with a TV camera that increases picture sequence frequency through means for deviating and suppressing the beam, a cyclic line counter, and a sawtooth generator.
- The cyclic line counter carries out one counting step for each line pulse and supplies an end-of-count pulse after p line pulses, which is applied to the beam suppression circuit of the TV camera for picture beam suppression. The sawtooth generator is synchronized with the output pulses of the counter to control the vertical deviation of the beam.
- The line counter is preferably a programmable counter, and the sawtooth generator and the beam suppression circuit are controlled via a delay device. The delay time of the delay device constitutes a selectable part of a line period and is triggered by the output of the counter.
- The invention increases picture sequence frequency, allowing for the recording of rapid processes with high resolution, and is suitable for recording IR, UV, or X-ray pictures.

• The text describes a system and method for handling multimedia calls in a communication network, specifically for clients with legacy phones and services.
• The system uses a blended call approach, which combines voice and multimedia functions into a single communication session.
• A multimedia server is associated with a telephony server, and a blender function manages blended calls using the appropriate functions of each server.
• The blender receives an incoming call and initiates a single session with two call components: a voice call component and a multimedia call component.
• The voice call component is handled through the telephony server, and the multimedia call component is handled through the multimedia server.
• The blender may also process outgoing calls from users with blended capabilities, initiating two call components and handling them as a single session.
• The system is well-suited for use with a Session Initiation Protocol for Telephones (SIP-T) configuration, as the information in SIP-T messages is helpful in setting up and tearing down the parallel call components.

• The text describes a content synchronization framework for connected devices that allows for contextual synchronization over various communication network topologies. The framework is highly scalable, supports multiple languages and character sets, and enables a client device to have the latest and most relevant content based on a user's and/or device's context.
• The synchronization framework includes a client, at least one central reference point server, a network (such as the Internet), and external partners. The client and server host algorithms of the present systems and methods, while the network is used for communication purposes between the central reference point, client, external partners, and/or download servers.
• The synchronization process involves the client sharing contextual information or dynamic attributes with the central reference point, which are used to compile bundle information for the requesting client. The central reference point then composes a response made up of zero or more bundles, with the bundle files listed in an order of priority for the client device. The client device composes a delta list of all the files in the bundle that are different from local copies available to the client device and downloads the files indicated in the delta list in the download order.
• Each bundle contains a set of properties that direct the client device in understanding the content and properties of files named in the bundle. Bundle properties tell the client device locations of files in the bundle, list download priorities for files, and inform the client device of actions that need to be performed on the bundle after it has been downloaded. File descriptions also have properties that help the client determine if the subject file is new and aid in processing the file.

* The present invention is a method and system for facilitating communication between the finder and owner of a lost or misplaced object using a unique ID and a virtual locale (e.g. website address).
* The owner is provided with specially prepared tags with a unique ID and a reference to a virtual locale, which they can affix to their possessions. The owner then registers the tag IDs and their contact information on a centralized and network accessible database.
* The finder can access the virtual locale using the reference on the tag, and communicate with the owner anonymously through the system.
* The system includes a database for storing an association between owner contact information and a unique ID, and a module for forwarding finder communications to the owner.
* The system can also include features for editing account settings, viewing and closing open cases, and searching for an ID number.
* The system can be implemented using various programming languages, operating systems, and database systems.

• The invention was made with government support and the government has certain rights in the invention.
• The invention is related to electron multipliers used in photomultipliers and particle detectors, specifically channel electron multipliers and microchannel plates.
• There are two types of conventional electron multipliers: discrete dynode multipliers and continuous electron multipliers.
• Discrete dynode multipliers consist of dynode stages that initiate and amplify a cascade of electrons, with each stage biased at a high negative voltage relative to the anode.
• The gain of a discrete dynode multiplier is given by the equation G D =γ I γ SE N−1, where γ SE is the average number of secondary electrons emitted by an electron from one dynode impacting on the next sequential dynode and N is the number of dynodes used in the detector.
• Continuous electron multipliers, such as channel electron multipliers and microchannel plates, employ one or more high resistivity glass channels or tubes, each of which acts as a series of continuous dynodes.
• The gain of a continuous electron multiplier can be modeled as a series of discrete dynodes and is given by the same equation as for discrete dynode multipliers.
• The foil electron multiplier, in accordance with the present invention, encompasses a next generation design of electron multipliers that uses a sequential series of thin foils in an evacuated enclosure to multiply electrons in a series of transmission stages.
• The gain of a foil electron multiplier is maximized by maximizing the electron transmission through the foil, maximizing the transmission through the support grid, and maximizing the secondary electron emission yield of the foil material.
• The gain advantage of the foil electron multiplier over conventional multipliers lies in the term γ SE +1, which represents the secondary electron yield from a primary electron exiting a foil and the continuation of the primary electron with the secondaries that it produces.

• The 3-D Phenomenoscope is a system that allows for the viewing of 3-dimensional and other special effects in motion pictures using ordinary film or digital technology.
• The system utilizes the Pulfrich effect, which causes lateral motion in an ordinary motion picture to appear in 3-dimensions when viewed through the 3-D Phenomenoscope.
• The 3-D Phenomenoscope consists of viewing glasses with individually controllable lenses, a digital photo sensor to capture and convert the viewed motion picture into digital images, a computer processor and program to process the digital images and identify synchronization events, and a means to provide individual control for the darkening of the right and left hand lenses based on the identified synchronization events.
• Unlike prior inventions that used shutter glasses, the control for the viewing glasses in the 3-D Phenomenoscope is not a wired, wireless, or infrared signal, but information calculated in real-time from successive frames of the motion picture.
• The lenses of the viewing glasses may take 3 different states: clear-clear, clear-darkened, and darkened-clear.
• The viewing glasses are able to process successive digital images, identify lateral movement and synchronization events, and cause the lenses of the viewing glasses to assume the appropriate right-left lens states.
• The 3-D Phenomenoscope allows for older or motion pictures produced before the invention of the 3-D Phenomenoscope to be viewed with a 3-dimensional effect.
• The battery-powered viewer glasses are controlled in real-time by an intelligent processor packaged with the glasses, so 3-dimensional viewing works equally well whether the movie is viewed on a TV, DVD player, PC, or in a movie house.
• The 3-D Phenomenoscope is not limited to the Pulfrich effect and can be extended to other motion picture video effects that result from the processing of the motion picture images by a processor on the viewing glasses, and the resulting control of the viewing glasses lenses.

<summary>
 
* The invention describes a method and apparatus for dicing semiconductor wafers using pressure to mechanically separate the individual die from the wafer without a wafer saw.
* The process involves forming trenches along the scribe lines on a semiconductor wafer and then applying mechanical pressure to the wafer to singulate the individual die.
* The apparatus includes a pad for supporting a semiconductor wafer, a positioning member to position the wafer on the pad, and a pressure mechanism to apply mechanical pressure to the wafer and singulate the individual die.
</summary>

The invention describes a method and apparatus for dicing semiconductor wafers using pressure to mechanically separate the individual die from the wafer without a wafer saw. The process involves forming trenches along the scribe lines on a semiconductor wafer and then applying mechanical pressure to the wafer to singulate the individual die. The apparatus includes a pad for supporting a semiconductor wafer, a positioning member to position the wafer on the pad, and a pressure mechanism to apply mechanical pressure to the wafer and singulate the individual die.

* The text describes a field emission display (FED) device that includes a cathode, an anode, and multiple field emission elements (e.g. carbon nanotubes) that emit high-energy electrons.
* The FED device also includes a protection structure that includes at least one reduction plate or electrode, which is negatively charged and located between the cathode and the field emission elements.
* The reduction plate or electrode attracts positive nitrogen and oxygen ions formed by the high-energy electrons, preventing the ions from contacting the cathode and inducing surging of an excessive electrical current to the cathode and field emission elements.
* The reduction plate or electrode is typically made of an electrically-conductive metal and is separated from the cathode by an insulation layer.
* The protection structure can take various forms, such as elongated and parallel reduction plates or electrodes that extend parallel and adjacent to the cathode strips on which the field emission elements are provided, or a meshwork-shaped or net-shaped configuration.
* The FED device according to the present invention substantially prolongs the lifetime of field emission elements in the device by preventing surges in electrical current from being drawn to the cathode and inducing burnout damage to the field emission elements.

* The present invention is an image sensor with multiple imaging planes, including a top imaging plane and imaging planes on two edge surfaces.
* The sensor includes a P-type substrate with a highly doped bottom layer and an upper layer having a high carrier lifetime.
* Image sensor elements are formed in the upper layer and include an image sensing region and a charge collecting and transfer means.
* A P+ layer is formed between each edge surface and the column of image sensor elements adjacent to the edge surface, creating a barrier to electron movement and guiding charge carriers toward the CCDs.
* The thickness of the upper layer determines the effective vertical aperture dimension in the edge surfaces of the sensor.
* The sensor can be used to simultaneously image a plurality of planes, and the concept of forming an imaging plane on an edge of a sensor can be used in image sensors with any number of columns of image sensor elements on a top surface.
* The image sensors can be used for color applications, with different color filters placed over the image sensor elements in different imaging planes.
* A second embodiment of the image sensor includes CCDs with lightly-doped N-type regions extended to the edges, increasing the lateral extent of the depletion region and improving charge collection.
* The image sensors can be mounted on an insulated support block, with bond pads shifted to the ends of the sensor and an opaque coating applied on die edges to prevent stray light absorption.

* The text describes a system and method for transferring network administrative functions from a master device to a slave device in a home network, to minimize total power consumption while ensuring optimal network administration.
* The network includes various devices capable of performing specific nominal functions and communicating via a network medium, with one device serving as the network master node to perform network administrative functions.
* The network master node can transfer its administrative functions to a network slave node, allowing it to enter a power management state and reduce power consumption.
* The transfer process involves sending data enabling the administrative functions to the slave node, which then becomes the new network master node.
* The network master node determines which slave node to transfer the functions to based on predetermined selection criteria, such as visibility, intelligence/functional capabilities, or user selection.
* The network slave node accepts the transfer request and receives the transferred network administrative functions to become the new network master node.
* When any device becomes activated, it checks for the presence of beacons on the network to determine whether to become the network master node or a slave node.

1. The invention describes an antenna array for measuring the elevation angle of a radio wave source using radio interferometric techniques. The array consists of at least four antennae arranged in at least two equi-spaced linear triplets perpendicular to a ground plane, with each triplet having a specific spacing of elements and height of the center element above the ground plane. The system uses radio receiver means to obtain information signals from each antenna, and logic means to combine and divide the signals to provide a quotient signal that is a function of the elevation angle but not the ground reflection coefficient.
2. The array can operate in either receive or transmit mode. In receive mode, the signal processing circuits in the antenna receivers provide unambiguous angle measurement. In transmit mode, the transmitted signal from each antenna in the array must be coded so that it can be identified to enable a quotient representing angle to be derived for each triplet in a remote receiver. A common coherent carrier is required for the transmissions from each element of any triplet, but coherence between triplets is not required.
3. The system can be used for various applications such as determining the range, identity, and elevation angle of an aircraft carrying a suitable transponder. It can also be used to provide coding by radio transmissions of angles in space, where the optimum value of the elevation angle of the receiver with respect to the array ground plane can be obtained.

- The text describes a new design for a subminiature lamp assembly that addresses several problems with conventional designs. The new design uses a high temperature polymer to surround and support the glass envelope, providing a compression seal and improved heat resistance. This design also eliminates the need for an adhesive to hold the glass envelope in place, which can break down over time due to thermal cycling and cleaning procedures.
- The new design also includes a potting material under the glass envelope to help stabilize the electrical leads and protect them from damage. The polymeric seal support and potting material can be made from materials with high temperature resistance, chemical resistance, and low outgassing, making them suitable for use in medical and scientific instruments. The design also minimizes the number of sealing points and maximizes the length of the seal surface to prevent the escape of harmful gasses and fluids into the instrument.

• The text describes a technique for realizing a GDFE Precoder for multi-user (MU) MIMO systems that significantly reduces the computational cost while resulting in no capacity loss.
• The described implementation of a GDFE Precoder relaxes the requirement for knowledge of the covariance matrix (S zz ) corresponding to “Least Favorable Noise,” which is a key component in conventional design and requires extensive computational cost.
• The technique provides a uniform framework for realizing a GDFE Precoder and does not require channel reduction when the Input Covariance Matrix (S xx ) for downlink channel is rank deficient.
• The described implementation achieves significant improvement in computational cost over conventional GDFE Precoders.
• The text also describes a method for configuring a GDFE Precoder in a base station of a MU-MIMO wireless system, including computing a filter matrix C using one of a plurality of alternative formulas, and based on the computation of the filter matrix C, computing a transmit filter matrix B, a feedforward filter matrix F, and an interference pre-cancellation matrix G.
• The text also describes a GDFE based precoder in a base station of a MU-MIMO wireless system having k user terminals, each user terminal having associated therewith a feedforward filter, which includes a feedforward path, a feedback path, and an interference pre-cancellation block denoted by I-G disposed in the feedback path. The interference pre-cancellation matrix G in the interference pre-cancellation block is determined by computing a filter matrix C using one of a plurality of alternative formulas, and based on the computation of the filter matrix C, computing a transmit filter matrix B, a feedforward filter matrix F, and an interference pre-cancellation matrix G.

• The invention relates to a heat-dissipating device and a housing thereof, specifically an axial fan with an increased intake airflow rate and a housing that enhances heat-dissipating performance.
• Conventional fans have restrictions in the dimension of the rectangular fan housing, limiting the air passage and blade design, and only achieving limited improvement in increased intake airflow rate.
• The invention's objective is to provide a heat-dissipating fan and housing that enlarges the intake airflow area without modifying assembling conditions, enhancing heat-dissipating efficiency.
• The housing includes an outer frame with a passage for air streams, having a sidewall that extends radially outwards to enlarge the intake or discharge area.
• The sidewall of the passage may extend in various manners, such as symmetrical, frustum-conical, or frustum-elliptically conical, and can be formed with an inclined portion or beveled edge.
• The housing can be used with a notch in the sidewall to enlarge the intake area for lateral side air streams.
• The heat-dissipating device includes an impeller and housing, with the housing having a passage and a sidewall that extends radially outwards to enlarge the intake/discharge area.
• The dimension of the blade of the impeller increases along with the radially outwardly extending direction of the sidewall of the passage.
• The heat-dissipating system includes a casing, electrical elements, and a heat-dissipating device mounted on the casing for dissipating heat generated from the electrical elements.
• The heat-dissipating device can be an axial fan, and may include a heat sink assembled with the housing.

* The electroluminescent display panel according to the present invention is composed of various layers laminated on a glass substrate, including a first electrode layer, a first insulation layer, a first luminescent layer, a second luminescent layer, a second insulation layer, and a second electrode layer.
 * The first luminescent layer emits light including no visible red light components, and the second luminescent layer emits light including visible red light components. The second luminescent layer partly overlaps the first luminescent layer, forming a single layer portion and a double layer portion. The single layer portion emits green light at a low level voltage and the double layer portion emits lemon light which is a mixture of green and orange at a high level voltage.

• The text describes an electronic portable communications terminal for Internet/network telephony. The terminal includes audio means for reproducing and recording sound, converting means for converting the recorded sound into transmission data, and protocol means for handling and controlling communication of the received and transmission data in accordance with a standardized Internet/network protocol. The terminal also includes wireless communications means for wireless near field communication of the received and/or transmission data in a wireless data format with a connecting unit.

• The invention aims to provide a communications terminal that uses a network and/or the Internet for transferring information/data representing digitized speech, increases the flexibility with respect to wireless communication/connection with a network and/or the Internet, does not need specialized equipment and functionality to provide a connection to a network and/or the Internet, and enables flexibility with respect to functionality. The terminal is also designed to be relatively simple, have a small size, and have a low power consumption.

* The integration of non-SiO2 based oxides directly or indirectly on Si is difficult due to the strong reactivity of Si with oxygen, resulting in the formation of a SiO2 or silicate layer at the Si//oxide interface.
* High-dielectric constant oxide (e.g. a ferroelectric oxide) can have a large dielectric constant, a large spontaneous polarization, and a large electrooptic properties. Ferroelectrics with a large dielectric constant can be used to form high density capacitors but can not deposited directly on Si because of the reaction of Si to form a low dielectric constant layer.
* Putting the high dielectric material on a conductive layer has not solved the problem, as the prior art materials generally either form a silicide which allows the diffusion of silicon into the high dielectric materials, or react with silicon or react with the high dielectric oxide to form low dielectric constant insulators.
* Ferroelectrics also have interesting electrooptic applications where epitaxial films are preferred in order to reduce loss due to scattering from grain boundaries and to align the oxide in order to maximize its anisotropic properties.
* While Pb/Bi-containing high-dielectric materials are convenient because of their relative low annealing temperatures and their desirable properties in the small grains, Pb and Bi are very reactive and have been observed to diffuse into and through metals such as Pd or Pt.
* A Ge buffer layer on Si oxidizes much less readily and can be used to prevent or minimize the formation of the low dielectric constant layer. An epitaxial Ge layer on Si provides a good buffer layer which is compatible with Si and also many oxides. Unlike other buffer layers, Ge is a semiconductor and is compatible with Si process technology.
* The epitaxial growth of Ge on top of the ferroelectric or high-dielectric constant oxide is also much easier than Si which makes it possible to form three dimensional epitaxial structures.
* The Ge buffer layer can be epitaxially gown on the Si substrate allowing the high dielectric constant oxide to be epitaxially gown on the Ge and hence epitaxially aligned to the Si substrate.
* The epit

* The text describes a receiver input circuit that aims to eliminate undesired signal actuation of non-linear components in the signal path, which can result in distortions. The circuit achieves this by using several amplification control circuits, each with a specific function and bandwidth. The first control circuit avoids unwanted overloading of the mixer stage and varactor diodes, while the second control circuit prevents overloading of the mixer stage and frequency influences acting upon the oscillator. A third control circuit can be used to support the other control circuits or to lower the amplification of the circuit in the case of small usable signals, providing better protection from stronger spurious signals.
* The input circuit includes an input network with reactance elements and a PIN diode for controllable signal attenuation, a preamplifier stage, a mixer and oscillator stage, an intermediate frequency filter, rectifier circuits, and a control signal processing circuit. The control circuit is based on a PIN diode, which has the advantage of protecting all distortion-forming circuit components against signal overloading during control and protecting the following amplifier component against high-voltage discharge surges from the antenna.
